description:
Every time I come here I try to get something that's not the Chicken Pesto Parm but I always seem to end up ordering that, haha. It's always been fresh and delish (just wish I could substitute for more spicy broccoli rather than spinach without spending extra)! I tend to only come here for dinner on a weekday so there's never really a line like there is during the lunch rush.

If you use their app you can order online and just pick up in store! Minus one star because their salads are so expensive (~$15). ):
author: Alice C.

description:
As a friend put it... sweetgreen is the "poor man's Mixt".

I remember going to sweetgreen in Palo Alto and loving it. They had this amazing omega-3 fish salad. I looked for the salad this time, and it looks like they have done away with most of the pre-made options and replaced it with 2-3 seasonal salads (none of which looked particularly interesting to me). So I decided to make my own salad.

It started off poorly when I couldn't figure out where the list of my protein options were. There's a board listing some of the items, but I later discovered that it wasn't comprehensive.

I asked the lady. She listed all of the options. I was already overwhelmed with trying to keep a list of ingredients I wanted in my head. 

It's cafeteria line style so you get to see all the options you can put on your salad. The problem was that there were no labels for anything. Not only was I not sure what some of the things were, I also didn't know if they were premium items, which were extra.

Me: "Can I get the heirloom tomatoes?"
Lady: "That is extra, is that ok?" (Note: she was great, because she told me these things upfront. Some places don't say anything, and then you pay $25 for what you thought was a $12 salad.)
Me: "Oh ok, can I get the regular tomatoes then?"
Lady: (gets tomatoes- ok good, that's not extra)
Me: "Can I get the peaches?"
Lady: "Oh that is also extra."
Me: "Ok.... what is not extra?"
Lady: "Apples aren't extra."
Me: "Ok... I'll get the apples then."
(And it went on like that for a while as I tried to guess which items were extra and not extra)

I mean really? Protein- extra. I get it. Avocado- extra. I get it. Peaches are extra, but apples are not? I don't get it. Roasted brussels are extra, but roasted broccoli is not? I don't get it. The haphazardness of this wouldn't be a problem if they just clearly stated everything. It's cool that things are seasonal and local, but it is super frustrating not to know what you are getting for what you're paying. I spent probably 10 mins just standing in front of the menu trying to figure out what to get.

As for the salad, it was fine. The spicy cashew dressing was really good. The portion was on the weaker side for a salad.
author: Alice T.

description:
Over the summer, I interned about two blocks away from sweetgreen, and came here every night to grab dinner. Sweetgreen has some of the most delicious and freshest ingredients, and all salads are customizable. My favorites are the chicken parm bowl and guacamole greens. Also, the salad chefs are all really nice / patient and efficient!

However, I do think that their online mobile ordering system needs to be refined a little. Getting your salad via mobile ordering can actually take longer than if you just stood in the line and ordered salad in person.

Now that I'm back in Connecticut for school, I really miss sweetgreen but will be sure to visit the 2nd street location if I ever come back to San Francisco!
author: Claire L.

description:
UGH, I can't believe I've paid ~$15 for a salad each time I come here. After they announced "burrata," it comes OMG, take my money!! 

My favorite salad from sweetgreen is their Peach Burrata (Local peaches, burrata, tomatoes, red onion, basil, roasted almonds, organic mesclun, shredded kale, balsamic vinaigrette), and I'm kind of sad that it's a seasonal salad, but am happy that maybe once it's gone, I won't be spending on $15 salads (after taxes) anymore, but yet again, you can add burrata to any salad now. 

Though the Peach Burrata salad is good, it hasn't been consistent the 3+ times I've came here to get the salad. The first time was perfect - every ingredient was mixed well together, great portion of burrata right on top to mix in. The second time I got ordered online and picked it up, and nothing was mixed together. I'm paying the same price, and am doing more work. Sadness. Third time, I went in person, waited in line for over 30 mins, and my salad wasn't filled to the top. I felt a bit ripped off. The 4th time, the basil wasn't ripped up, so I got some whole basil leaves within some bites, and they let the liquids drip in the salad, so I got basil water and burrata liquids (the condensation part from the lid?) into my salad.
author: Rita W.

description:
I've always strayed away from sweet greens because of the price and long lines, but I finally tried it today using the app. You get $3 off your first order and don't have to wait in line! I custom made my salad and it ended up being cheaper than the pre-selected ones. I also got a couple of different sauces to try (you can get up to 3) and ended up liking the green goddess ranch the most. 

It was super filling and delicious, with flavors/options I don't see normally at other salad spots. I'll definutely be ordering from sweet greens a lot more often now.
author: Hannah K.

description: My office is nearby, so I eat here all the time.  Really enjoy the salads.  I have to admit I'm put off by the salad maker who has to stop to pull up his pants every 10 seconds with the same hands that are making my salad Yes, he's wearing gloves, but does it matter if the gloves are going into his pants all the time.  Yuk.
author: Paul Z.

description:
I love sweetgreen! I don't care how long the line is or how much the salad costs, I'm never going to stop loving it. I order the Hummus Tahina salad everytime, which includes kale, romaine, cucumber, onion, tomato, za'atar breadcrumbs, feta, herb falafel, hummus, and (a medium amount of) cucumber tahini yogurt dressing. I highly recommend ordering that salad for yourself. And yes, I always ask for the side of bread because I love eating that with any leftover hummus from the salad. There is of course an insane line at lunchtime between 11:30am-1:00pm but it moves quickly enough and it's really not as bad as it looks. My salad is always made by a nice human that's trying to get my salad made and me through the line as quickly as possible, which I appreciate. There is no small talk - I just tell them my salad choice and meet them at the end to repeat how much dressing I would like everything to be tossed with.

Sometimes my salad is enormous and the lid will barely close, and sometimes its not, but it still tastes great and that's all I care about. I'll be back once a week probably forever.
author: Bri T.

description: Delicious food but really stupid that you are out of an item for the salad I choose, and charging me extra for substituting with a different item...
author: Erhan A.

description:
If you're going to spend $15 on a salad, you might as well go to sweetgreen. I think sweetgreen has the biggest selection of salads that's consistently fresh in the FiDi/SoMa area.

Definitely order to-go for lunch or you'll get stuck in a huge line. The to-go orders take about 15 minutes for them to make. They come with the dressing on the side so your greens won't get soggy and you can pick up right on the shelf next to the pay counter. Downside: the salad isn't tossed
author: Jessica C.

description:
A guaranteed delicious salad. Could you replicate it at home? Sure. Is it expensive? Kind of. Do they sometimes make mistakes? Yeah, but instead of complaining on Yelp, they can make you a new salad if you're a nice person and just tell them they messed up. They left out chicken in my salad once, and I was sad and equally as lazy about walking back to ask for a redo (just like some reviewers below me), but that's on me at this point, no?

I don't even like salad as a meal or eat that much of it. However, if I had to pick a place for salad in SF, this would be it. The ingredients are fresh, the warm bowls include grains, and the flavors are really good (like the whole is better than the sum of its parts - which is rare at salad places). My favorite bowl is the harvest bowl - with minor modifications for my preferences. I usually choose a bowl or salad on the menu, but you can also create them yourself.

Service is fast and friendly. The place is beautiful with lots of room to sit. Kind of expensive but they use local / organic ingredients when possible which is pretty cool (they have a blackboard that lists the source area/farm of each ingredient).
author: Nelya T.

description:
I love the salads here so much that I've never been able to wait long enough to take a photo for yelp.
I usually make my own with kale, chickpeas, avocado, carrots, broccoli, cucumbers, tomatoes with a mix of the spicy cashew and lemon cilantro dressing. Hmmmm sooo good!
The bread on the side is just ok and prices are kind of high (specially if you want to add some of the special toppings like asparagus, avocado, chickpeas, falafel etc) 
I would not go here everyday, but maybe couple times a month for a healthy yet tasty meal.
author: Dhanashree K.

description:
I frequent this place quite often for two reasons: it's healthy and super duper convenient. The ingredients have always been very fresh. I've had a couple instances where stuff wasn't really chopped properly or they forgot to do my substitutions etc. but all in all it's been good to me.

You must get the app! I'm always amazed at how many people are waiting in line at lunch sometimes it's out the door and working it's way around the corner and I just want to shake people and say "you can order on the app!!!" I literally walk past them every time, walk up to the shelves with all the prepared salads in alphabetical order, grab mine and a napkin and fork and head out the door. It's so quick!
author: Fahren F.

description:
That's an expensive salad.  Or well, excuse me, "bowl."  Which really just means more toppings on your salad.

Sweetgreen has some pretty decent healthy options, and allows for all kinds of customization on the set menu items.  You're pretty limited in terms of variety of dishes (salad or more salad), but they manage to make a bowl of greens pretty fun to eat.

My friend introduced me to the spicy cashew dressing, which will now top all of my sweetgreen orders.

Tips and Tricks
-Don't bother waiting in line, pay online or in the app and pick up your order at the counter
-You can sub just about anything in a bowl or salad, as long as it falls into the same category (might change the price tho)
author: Jessica L.

description:
What a pleasant surprise this place was. Super popular place, I probably should have online ordered but I walked in and waited in line.

I had no idea what to get but the Pesto Chicken looked good. 

Pesto Chicken $14.21 - roasted chicken, spicy broccoli, tomatoes, shaved parmesan, za'atar breadcrumbs, warm quinoa, organic spinach, sweetgreen hot sauce, pesto vinaigrette. 

Super good, large salad and I even had portions left over the next day and it still tasted delicious.  Ranks high on my SF Salad rankings below. 

I like Healthy Foods...occasionally ...lol. For the past year or so I workout multiple times everyday so I typically try to eat at least one Salad a day. Often times I bring my own salad for lunch but sometimes I venture out in the city for some healthy greens.  

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the Salad Spots in the City. They are all pretty good this is just my take. 


Rod's San Francisco Salad Rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). I have rankings various foods like Boba, Ramen, Steakhouse, Chicken and Wafffles(random right?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places 

Ranked from Fave to least fave (Business owners don't hate me, all these places are good) 

1 Café du Soleil-Nicoise Salad
2 SweetGreen-Pesto Chicken
3 Darwin Café-Baby Spinach 
4 La Fromagerie-La Mancha Salad
5 Mission Picnic -Deluxe Cobb
6 Mixt-Mixt Cobb
7 Plutos-Custom salad
8 La Capra-The Cobb
9 Tender Greens-Chinese Chicken
10 Soma Eats-Spinach, Date and Goat Cheese Salad
11 Blue Barn Gourmet-Cobber (Cobb Salad)
12 Split Pea Seduction-The Squash salad
13 Boxed Foods-Boxed Chicken Salad
14 Kitava-Pesto Chicken Cobb
15 Native Co-Native Salad
16 Soma Chicken-Caesar Salad
17 Proper Food-Lemon Quinoa Salad with Chicken
18 Eatsa-Various Salads/bowls 
19 The New Spot on Polk-Asian Chicken
20 Organic Coup-Kale/Caesar Combo 
21 Uno Dos Tacos-Fish Salad Bowl
author: Rod M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but it's always such a disaster. Waiting in that confusingly disorganized line is not happening for me and so unless with a friend (and sometimes even with) I order online but their timing and execution is often quite bad. Warm bowls are clearly made far in advance so they're not actually warm anymore. I find pieces of chicken in my vegetarian salads. And the latest example: placed my order an hour ahead and arrive to find 30 angry people crammed in around empty shelves all waiting for their online orders. No attempt by staff to mitigate the situation with apologies or reassurance that food is actually coming. 

The quality, selection, and value are unremarkable. There are plenty of other nearby salad options that aren't such a headache.
author: Cristina S.

description:
There is chicken in my salad. I had replaced it for tofu. There were at least 3 pieces of chicken in the salad. This hasn't happened for the first time - but only happens when I place order online.

I'm not sure how seriously the Soma staff takes this, but for a vegetarian, it's not a pleasant experience to find piece of meat in their food. It's a big bold red sign for me and I will only give 1 more chance to sweet greens before I decide to never return.

This is absolutely unacceptable! If they put chicken by mistake, they need to make a new salad and not just take it out.

My lunch AND money  is wasted and I'm not going to walk back to the store to get more food. Utterly disappointing, given the fact that it's my go-to place.
author: Namrata J.

description:
I like Sweetgreen a lot when I'm visiting New York City. Clean, fresh, tasty. The staff there were friendly. 
Here you get mediocre salads with tiny bit of protein, seriously and for 15 dollars. Worst thing is that the bathroom here is nasty. I can't imagine the health and safety of the food here. I got really grossed out and decided to leave this comment.Disappointed.
author: Hai L.

description:
As a huge fan of Mixt and Tender Greens, I didn't feel the need to expand my salad repertoire in downtown SF since I was already pretty happy with what I had. My East Coast friends kept raving about this spot though, so I decided to come along with them.

I got the shroomami (warm portabello mushroom) and a build your own with arugula, beets, dill, broccoli, and sweet potatoes, topped with miso dressing. The portabello mushroom was meaty, and cut into 1" pieces that were just enough for mouthfeel, but not overly large. The tofu was fine, but not memorable. Ingredients went together well, and overall felt filling. I think this is great for someone who likes chopped salad, but a different style from Mixt and Tender Greens where the focus is on seeing the ingredients as large pieces.

The build your own tasted pretty similar to the shroomami given the overlap in ingredients I got. The beets and sweet potatoes were a good texture, and sliced thinly so you got good flavor in your mouth without having to chew a lot. The miso dressing added a good flavor, but wasn't anything I really had a strong opinion on. Overall, one salad was sufficient for a dinner portion. I added a piece of steelhead (+$5) and while it tasted fine, I thought it was a bit stiff / super healthy tasting vs. the meats at Mixt (like the steak) and at Tender Greens (like the ahi tuna).

I don't quite understand the hype given prices, but it's tasty. A bit short of 3.5/5 for me, but don't dislike it.
author: Nicole H.

description: I love this place and come here often. I brought my friend here trying to convince him it's good but the guy Manual that made his salad was sloppy and rude. Usually the staff is extremely friendly but this guy clearly hates his job. He didn't even acknowledge us. I'll continue to come cause I like the place but my friend refuses to ever be back because of Manual. Jackie was great though!
author: Nicole H.

description:
I had the chance to try a sweetgreen salad as part of a scavenger hunt (it was included), and decided to come back again for lunch since it's pretty close to my office.

I like that you can order and pay through their app and then come by 30 minutes later to pick it up without having to wait in line. Using the app was very easy as well; you can choose from one of their premade salads or customize your own with various toppings, dressings, etc. Really glad I ordered online and only came for pick up, as the line around 12:15 was out the door.

I won't go into details about what I ordered, but everything was fresh and delicious. So why the 3 stars? Because of the price. My salad ended up costing over $15 bucks with just one protein (shrimp), so it's not exactly the cheapest spot. That's the typical SF fidi lunch for ya...

Side note: I wanted to mix the dressing in myself and was happy that it came on the side (I looked all over the app for the option and didn't see it).
author: Dianna H.

description:
First time here and got the kale caesar. Line is pretty long for lunch time but it moves fast!

Pretty inexpensive for lunch and salads taste great! Limited selection of salads but you can customize your own. 

I will be back!
author: Elaine C.

description:
The salads here are very tasty. However...i have come to learn that ordering online here is just not a good idea. They got the order wrong three times in a row, and when I questioned the guy about it and tried to get him to remake it, he started crying. I had only ordered their pesto parm with no modifications...not that picky but they just kept giving me random combinations of stuff 

I guess a lot of people were freaking out on him, the line was quite ling and customers were upset.

If you do just get in the normal line they generally get it right and I'll go back because food is good but wish we were able to order online without any drama.
author: E C.

description:
Pros: Salads are great as long as you get the right person making your salad, which I would say happens about 50% of the time. If you don't, you end up with a salad that is all lettuce and no toppings which just happened to me. I refused to pay $12 for it though until they fixed it!

Cons: This place is a total disaster after 11am. It gets too crazy and the people working there can't handle it. Also, cleanliness/food safety is a real issue for me here. Every time I eat here, they touch my salad no less than 5 times with their hands, trying to push it into the container. They have gloves, but really gloves don't do much if you're still touching everything while wearing the gloves! Also, I always get dressing on the side, and they have the person at the counter who is handling the money (sans gloves) make the side dressing. They then stick that side dressing directly onto your salad so it's going from the cashier's hands directly onto your food. I now make sure I grab the dressing from the cashier before they place it on my salad! Maybe it's just me, but that's not ok! Food safety 101 folks.
author: Mindy G.

description: Sadly I am done eating at Sweetgreen, a place I've loved and frequented since 2015. The food is delicious but this is the second time I've found an insect in my food in less than 2 years. The first time was at the Palo Alto location where my colleague found maggots in his Shroomami after I convinced them all to have it. This time I found a tick in my salad. Maybe all the lot of you are tougher than me and wouldn't be disgusted by such sights but I can't bring myself to eat here anymore. Guess it's just too fresh for me.....
author: Neechi M.

description:
My favorite salad chain. I'm not usually a fan of salads but sweetgreen salads are great because the toppings are delicious and well seasoned and really adds flavor to the salad. Great selection of both salads and bowls and their seasonal stuff is great for variety. My favorites are the harvest bowl and the miso bowl. The bread is also great. I like that they allow for unlimited substitutions.

I definitely recommend getting their app for their loyalty program as well as for ordering ahead (although they don't mix the salads for you).
author: Jenny J.

description:
Gave this place a second chance, and I'm sold. Went inside the venue this time instead of ordering delivery, so felt I had more control over the type of salad/options I was putting together. 

Did a "build your own" model, lots of "base" options such as kale, arugula, mixed greens, romaine, etc. You can get multiples, so did a kale arugula split. You can add up to 4 regular toppings and 1 premium, for a base price of less than $10, and for every regular topping more, it's only 50 cents extra. Got a huge fresh bowl of salad greens and colorful add-ons like raw beets, sweet potatoes, spiced broccoli, and avocado for about $11 including tax. Obviously, adding a premium protein like chicken or salmon would add up a little more.

Staff are very friendly and patient in explaining all your options and the costs associated. Will be adding this to my salad rotation places (Mixt, SoMa Eats, Eatsa).
author: Alison A.

description:
Good 'ole sweetgreen never fails to disappoint. I love how convenient this location is in SOMA/FiDi. Consequently, lines during peak lunch hours are frightening, BUT they have a fabulous app! Order ahead of time (like 15 mins minimum), jump through the line, and pick up your order that's sitting on the shelf. I'm usually in and out of the place in literally 30 seconds. 

I've tried a lot of their classic salads/bowls, seasonal selections, and built my own as well. All have been excellent, but my favorite classic is the Spicy Sabzi. I'm loving the Shroomami as one of the seasonal bowls; they're perfect if you're looking for something slightly heartier than just greens. The ingredients themselves aren't super special, but there's something about the dressings that makes every bite so flavorful. I'm always satiated afterwards without feeling heavy.

My only gripe is that prices are higher than the East Coast. My friend and I compared prices on our sweetgreen apps and there was a $2 on almost all the SF selections. Nevertheless, prices are on par with other SF salad establishments, and you definitely get more bang for your buck here.
author: Denise L.

description:
We were in search of a good salad place that had seafood options and came upon this little gem. Thankfully it wasn't too packed in here, and we were able to fit our double stroller with no problems. The staff was nice and friendly upon us entering the establishment (always a plus for me). The salad greens looked fresh (despite the sweltering heat). My partner chose to make his own concoction, but I went with the Rad Thai. It had a little bit of everything in it, and they didn't skimp on the shrimp (you know those places you go to where they give you a measly 3-4 shrimp and then have the NERVE to up charge an additional +$4.00). Not to mention, it was flavorful AND healthy and left me content and satisfied. 

One of the cool things about this place is that you not only get to make your own salad (or choose from other salad options), but they also ask how much dressing you like (because I'm definitely a light to medium dressing gal). You can also add additional toppings (for a premium, of course, but still not too bad). 

If only this place was open a bit later and had a couple more locations in the city...oh yea, and if they delivered, they would be golden. But still not a bad deal, great bang for your buck, and you're sure to get a great meal out of it. 

Likes:
-Salad options
-Seafood/veggies options for salads
-Fresh greens
-Good bang for your buck

Dislikes:
-Wish it were open later
-Needs delivery!
author: Tracy T.

description:
Tasty but pretty annoyed at the workers and the set up to order food. It is like Chipotle where it's an assembly line, but the glass is so high up that the workers constantly scream at you that "they can't hear you" even though you're screaming at the top of your lungs. If you try to make your own salad, they will mess it up. Also, their beets are raw- what?! lol 

Hated the experience, will not go back. I would advise Sweet Greens to lower their glass/plastic because literally everyone was screaming and it was a really bad experience. In our group of 3, 2 of the orders were wrong bc they couldn't hear us. Will not be back.
author: Mariam P.

description:
I had my doubts when sweetgreen popped up a block away from my office. Sure it was close by and convenient, but their bowls were ranging from $12+!! It seemed like an over-priced eatsa bowl (which at the time was less than $8) for the same amount of food. Whatever I ordered the first time did not do this place justice. It was from the menu but tasted horribly bland, and a little pricey. I stayed away for the next couple of months.

But one day I decided to give dear sweetgreen another shot at love. My coworker loved to order ahead online and out of the convenience of it, I followed suit. I believe I received a few dollars off for creating an online account with them and if you know me, I love saving a few bucks here and there. (I mean who doesn't??) That combined with the super smooth ordering and pick-up work flow, and a rather tasty order changed my mind about sweetgreen. Now I could see what all the hype was about. 

My current favorite order is seasonal (I'll be sad when winter is over). It's the winter squash + blue cheese warm bowl. If you're looking for something a little heartier than just salad, go for a warm bowl!!

Pros:
-locally sourced produce and ingredients. They have a giant black board showing where their ingredients are sourced from. Yay local!!
-customizable orders. Although the winter squash + blue cheese bowl is my favorite, I always sub out the blue cheese for goat cheese. So GOOD!

Cons:
-pricey depending on what you get
-super long line that wraps the entire inside during peak lunch hours

Tip:
-ORDER AHEAD ONLINE!!! Their website and app make it very easy to order, re-order favorites, and view history. You get to skip the long line of people full of regrets. It's super easy! Also, make sure you put your order around 11-11:15am if you want it ready by noon. 
-the app let's you collect rewards after a certain number of bowls. More dollars off!
author: Grace J.

description:
Freshest salads anywhere.  I frequent them all the time. 
Generous, clean, the best.  You can also customize.
author: Portia S.

description:
I absolutely love their salads! And the order for pick up option is extremely convenient since their lunch line is always out the door. When you order in the app, you go at your pick up time, then walk in and walk out. 

Most places will limit how many toppings you want to add but the limit on the custom orders this place offers is way more than enough. I always add goat cheese to my salad and it always leaves me wanting more. 

It's a little pricey but I feel like it's worth it for every once in a while. The ingredients are fresh and when you add avocado, you get half of an avocado. It's great.
author: Karina W.

description:
The moment I found out there was a sweetgreen in SF, I mapped it out and decided that that was where I was having lunch that day. 

I trekked the .3 miles and upon entry noticed with dismay (and distress) that the line snaked around the entire restaurant. However, I love my OMG Omega too much to have given up at that point. 

I ended up waiting in line for around 15 to 20 minutes for my $14 salad. Was it worth it? I certainly think so because I'm absolutely OBSESSED with their miso ginger dressing. Trust me, you gotta try it! 

So maybe I wouldn't come here in a day that I'm swamped at work (you won't have time to wait in line), but I'd most definitely stop by every once in awhile!
author: Christine W.

description: This place is one of the best and freshest I've ever been to. I come here almost daily and love the quality and the fact that the servings are big. A bit too pricey, that's true. Worth it anyways! Love making my own salads!
author: Lisa P.

description:
sweetgreen is hit or miss. The same standard salad (Kale Caesar with chicken) ordered on 3 occasions was all over the map - one had a paltry 6 small pieces of chicken, another way too much shaved cheese. The ratio of kale to romaine was also pretty inconsistent. On one occasion the Caesar dressing was spot on delicious and the other times, too much acid or too much of a raw garlic taste.

On top of that, the promise of ordering ahead and avoiding the super long line remains elusive. On one occasion my salad was ready early while most other times it's 5-10 late. Today, it was almost 20 mins late. An entire group of 5-6 of us commiserated over our hunger pangs against the back wall. One woman's salad was 35 mins late and then came with two ingredients missing.

For a place that stamps out mostly standard salads, I'm surprised by the inconsistency in preparation and delivery times. It's definitely "green", but how sweet it is in practice is debatable.
author: Wayne H.

description:
Customizing your salads here is pretty unsatisfying. EVERYTHING is extra and the small selection of items that aren't are weak.

I don't have a problem paying for sides and toppings if they're full of flavor. That is not the case here.

My steelhead topped romaine salad with curried cauliflower, brussels sprouts, avocado, portobello mushrooms, and sunflower seeds - was so disappointing. The fish didn't taste fresh and the curried cauliflower and mushrooms were bland. 

I didn't end up finishing it.

I am glad that sweetgreen exists - but I much prefer the more affordable and taste filled salad boasting spots nearby (SOMA Eats etc)

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The Salads: OUTSTANDING as always. The Costumer service and employees -- NOT SO MUCH! I am a BIG FAN of Sweetgreen's brand & along with my family, I Was satisfies with my salads. 

Now for my issue -- I went this past Tuesday & upon ordering 3 Kale Caesar Salads, the gentleman assisting me looked at me as though I was out of my mind and even opened his mouth wide open in shock. What can J say? I love the Caesar salads, but that's not what I expected. I then ordered a bowl for my sister and as I was asking for the ingredients in it, the young woman helping me kept on asking what I wanted and seemed confused at my choices. Again, unexpected. Needless to say, I still LOVE SWEETGREEN, I just was not the biggest fan of the costumer service.
author: Jose Q.

description:
Well, at least Ovo Cafe is gone. No offense to the previous owners, but that dismal Hong Kong-style fast food operation was well, dismal...like sitting in Economy class eating a meal you paid for and hoping to God the flight attendant would hurry back so you didn't have to keep staring at it. Yep, that bad. Now it appears to be a Mixt-type chain operation where the Chipotle-style approach gets applied to meal-size salads and warm grain bowls. It was the brainchild of three Georgetown students back east where they opened their first one in D.C. a decade ago. There are nearly forty of them, and there's no stopping them now.

They've started their assault on the West Coast, first at the old Oscar's in Berkeley (how I miss their greasy burgers) and now here on 2nd Street where I'm sure it's a lunch hour hit since white-collar FiDi workers love their salad bowls. Jamie W. suggested we try it one evening after a particularly stressful commute for me. The place has a pre-packaged modern look and was nearly empty as was usual at that hour on 2nd. I decided I was in no mood to study the abundant choices available for building a bowl and thought for my virginal visit, I would try one of their established menu choices.

I went with the $11.90 Shroomami, a big bowl of organic wild rice, shredded kale, raw beets, bean sprouts, basil, roasted sesame tofu, a mix of chopped portobellos, and spicy sunflower seeds drenched in a miso sesame ginger dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/2qlMb1p). It was relatively adequate considering the creation added up to 640 calories at that steeper-than-usual price tag. I must remember "seasonal" doesn't translate into low-calorie. Jamie ordered the $12.80 Pesto Portobello, which was an exorbitant 775 calories of warm quinoa, organic arugula, hot chickpeas, raw corn, spicy broccoli, warm portobellos, and chunks of roasted chicken.

It was mixed liberally in a pesto vinaigrette and came with a crusty wedge of sourdough bread (photo: http://bit.ly/2pxF8EO). Yes, it was better than mine for sure but at what price? 775 calories is quite a lot for a meal portrayed as a simple bowl coupled with that price. For all that, I'd like a waiter in a uniform and a quartet of Gypsy violinists playing "Fascination". The one indisputable highlight was the refreshing $2.50 Cranberry Ginger Fresca which was sweetened only with honey (photo: http://bit.ly/2oMl6aB). Give it a try if you must but proceed with caution as the calorie count was higher than I was hoping and so were the prices for a simple supper. Go ahead and call me a tightwad.

FOOD - 3 stars...seasonal yes, some of it tasty but low-calorie no
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...like every other seasonal salad chain
SERVICE - 2 stars...not very helpful really, they just look at you waiting
TOTAL - 3 stars...it neither overwhelms or underwhelms, it just whelms...at least it's not Ovo
author: Ed U.

description: I don't know why this place only has a 3.5 rating star. To me this place is a 5-Star place as long as you don't show up at 12 and want something immediately... I love the harvest salad: big fan of goat cheese and sweet potatoes. They could make kales edible! They switch menu for different season.
author: Isabelle L.

description:
I have ordered several salads and was usually quite happy, but some of my last few of orders went south. 

1) I placed an order 90 minutes in advance with a scheduled pickup for 12pm. When I arrived there was a backup and I stood there for 20 minutes waiting for the salad to be made. 
2) TWICE I found chicken in my salad. I'm a vegetarian, so this was a problem. 

I emailed sweetgreen about these issues and got credits for new meals, but I haven't used the last credit. Dropping meat into a vegetarian meal multiple times is a deal breaker for me.
author: Russ S.

description:
When you're in one of the moods to get a salad or a healthier food option in SF, Sweetgreen is the place to go. I recommend coming in between 11:15AM-11:30AM to beat the lunch rush. I came right at 11:30 and I went straight to the front to order, but once 12 hit the line was out the door. 

I enjoy getting the curry cauliflower! For around 500 calories you get a meal that can last you throughout most of your workday. You can't go wrong with the arugula base, warm quinoa, roasted chicken, and curry flavor topped with heavy tahini sauce. YUM! I couldn't even finish my bowl. 

I will say that they could definitely add more chicken to the dish though since the pieces were cut so small and an additional $2 for more meat is a bit pricey especially with the cost of this dish already being between $13-$14 without any add-ons. While the meals do make you full, I don't really believe in paying that much for a salad so I probs won't come here on the daily when there are other options in SF to try at a cheaper price.

Aside from that, this location is quick considering its location right in FiDi and the service friendly even through the rush. The frescas looked tasty too so it's definitely something I need to get next time to have on the side. Happy eating!
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I had a shroomami bowl here and I was delightfully surprised. It was the day after a huge, meat heavy, dinner and I was in the mood for something lighter for lunch. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much from what appeared to be an overpriced salad bar but I was wrong. My salad was delicious, filling and also just very unique. I had never had a salad like it and I am sure I will be coming back to this place to try more. 

The one negative for me was the drink. They offer a number of daily juices. I opted for a cranberry ginger. The ginger was way too strong, to the point of the drink actually being spicy. Not really what I was looking for.
author: James A.

description:
Rude and unprofessional staff. I was picking up a large
order and a staff person at the register lied and said they don't take orders in advance from their web site! It took nearly and hour to find a person who could help me find the correct order! Twenty salads were ordered and they were poorly packed in CVS bags and not even sealed properly. 

I would advise you check out their food safety ratings before you eat there!
author: Lucky G.

description:
I recently went to Sweetgreen. They specialize in hearty salads that are the main meal. There are two vegan salads on their default salad menu including the Spicy Sabzi that is a regular cold salad & Shroomami listed in the warm bowls. They have a board listing the salad's calories which was a nice feature. Other vegan options are available if you choose to DIY & make your own.

I decided to get the Shroomami that was 640 calories. It included organic wild rice, shredded kale, raw beets, bean sprouts, basil, roasted sesame tofu, warm portobello mix, spicy sunflower seeds, & miso sesame ginger dressing. 

For an extra $1.25 I had them add in some Avocado. They also ask you if you would like light, medium, or heavy for your dressing which was a nice touch. The salad came w/ a complimentary piece of rustic bread. 

My total for the Shroomami salad w/ the additional Avocado was $14.30. I felt it was a hearty & healthy meal that was tasty. I like that Sweetgreen uses produce from local farmers & there is a chalkboard that tells you which farms the produce comes from along w/ their locations.

Sweetgreen is a chain w/ branches in CA, DC, IL, MA, NY, PA, & VA. I like the concept & will be back!
author: Shane S.

description:
I've been here a few times now for lunch. I've only had their pre-made bowls and I haven't been disappointed yet. My two go-to bowls are the curry chickpea bowl and the mexican corn elote bowl (seasonal only as of the time of writing this). Both bowls are the perfect combination of sweet, salty, and savory. I'm not normally one to order something with no meat in it, but the mexican corn elote is just damn delicious. 

Pro-tip: Order ahead on their website/app and skip the line. The line can get pretty long here for lunch (out the door) and the bowl has always been ready at my pickup time when I order online.
author: Eric L.

description: Although their orders are big, they definitely need more dressing, so their salads just come out feeling like you're eating a bunch of raw foliage, and that's just not my cup of tea.
author: Mike C.

description:
I am extremely disappointed with this place. I thought it would be healthy and delicious, but it didn't meet my expectation. 
I ordered Guacamole Greens Salad. The only think I liked was freshly squeezed lime or lemon as a dressing. Greens were not very fresh and crispy, and tomatoes were smooshed. The worse part of the salad, and I kept it last to mention, raw pieces of chicken. Nowadays, with high rate of salmonella, I was very upset and scared to see raw pieces of chicken in my salad. 
I will never come back to the place again.
author: Jenna F.

description:
Very impressed by this place. I thought it was gonna be just another overpriced and somewhat mediocre salad bar, but my food was actually pretty good and the ingredients selection was nice. Prices were also more reasonable than what I had expected, considering the area and other similar places. 

I'm giving it four stars because the lines are ridiculous. I guess that means it's popular and that's not a bad thing, but if you have limited time in your lunch break, you may not want to spend it standing in line. Pro tip: order through the app and just go and pick it up. Their app kind of sucks and I wish they used Ritual instead, but whatever. It works and you'll skip the line.
author: Marta F.

description:
First thought "why is everyone lining up and paying $10 for salad? People are crazy"

Yesterday I became a proud crazy person. After coming here and try it for myself, I definitely see why everyone comes here. Definitely worth the whole $10. The food were so delicious and fresh and I love how they tell you on the board of where all items comes from. Also I love how it's credit card only and no cash. It speeds up the process so people don't need to get out change and drags out the line. 

Paid an extra $4 for shrimp and those were fire. So glad that I added those, I recommend everyone to try it if you love seafood or shrimp, you will taste the lemon flavor perfectly marinated on. Definitely will come again and it made me think about being vegan but then again that wouldn't work, since I love seafood and meat. Oh and they even include a slice of bread!
author: Christopher G.

description:
This is a bit of a walk from my office ... so after a 15 minute walk, I have to wait another 20 minutes in line.  There is always a line.

I first heard about them b/c I heard their founder speak at a conference I was attending.  

I like this place a LOT more than Mixt Greens ... which I why I'm willing to make the walk when Mixt is literally downstairs of my office.  My favorite salad is the OMG Omega.  It goes great with the cilantro watermelon drink.  

Definitely recommend if you don't have any work to do and can wait 25 minutes to grab a quick lunch to eat at your desk.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I love salads and I love customizing my meal, but unfortunately I always cringe at the idea of paying $10-15 for a salad when I can make a similar salad at home for much less. Probably not somewhere I'd visit often, but I'd come back if I wanted something healthy.

+ Pretty decently sized salads
+ Menu has composed bowls if you don't care to customize
+ Lots of options if you do want to customize
+ Unique options, including spicy broccoli and tasty cooked add-ons like roasted squash and mushrooms
+ Option to order ahead via app for scheduled pickup time (quick and convenient)
author: Jessie L.

description: A great salad lunch restaurant where they display a list of all the local producers in which they source their ingredients from. I had the curry cauliflower salad and it was very good with a delicious dressing. A great dressing, i think, makes the flavor of a salad and this salad was probably one of the best salads I've had. They come in the perfect proportion.
author: Xi-Er D.

description:
I go to Sweet Green at least twice a month since it's a few blocks from work. I like the service of the place and they offer lots of fresh, healthy options. Unfortunately I am never going back!! 

Looks like Sweet Greens came out with a new protein option. Never going back! Disturbing hinge was they didn't even care- only offered to remake the salad. Umm no, not much of an appetite after seeing a cockroach in my salad.
author: Sonia S.

description: They are nice and service is great. Never used their restroom almost a year. Today I did and disappointed. It doesn't look like they do clean everyday. Like the place them who do serve clean and green food. They should consider to clean their restroom first
author: Aykut K.

description:
Long lines, no cash accepted, decent salads.

So, the caveat is that I've only ever gotten Shroomami, which is a warm salad. It's pretty filing, and its pretty tasty. Many of the other salads don't seem as appetizing to me, but that's just me being a picky eater...

When you pay 12-15 dollars for a salad, you're paying to be picky. Luckily, you can customize your salads here if you want.  

Some salads, like Shroomami, don't come with meat. If you want to add meat +$3.

I enjoy the Shroomami salad, and it fills me up. I don't have the patience to wait in line though. If you end up going, go early, or go really late. Sometimes around 1:30pm the lines are still long. 

I usually just go to Porticos to build my own salad, but I come here from time to time as its a different flavour that I can't build at Porticos.
author: Kaje Y.

description: I'm generally not a huge fan of the overpriced and super hip salad places in the area. But occasionally, I find myself too lazy to fix my own lunch and when this happens, I like to stop by sweetgreen. Preferably before 12pm and the long lunch lines. Then you'll have your salad in your hands within minutes, if you can decide among the many options, that is. I like their Caesar salad and more recently, I had their peach and goat cheese one, which is perfect for warm summer days. Quality ingredients and nice combinations, but I just can't get over the fact that they think $12-14 for a salad is ok. I just can't.
author: Katja S.

description:
Ever spent $18 on a super healthy bowl? I didn't. So glad I had a coupon, still ain't cheap. I got the pesto chicken bowl? and added avocado & falafel. The avocado was worth it to add, not so much the falafel...that was just ok.
 
This place only takes credit card...and no cash. Sometimes that seems cool because I rarely carry cash but I'd LIKE the option to pay cash or credit. I used the sweetgreen app and ordered it ahead of time. There's a pickup shelf to pick up your food. They didn't add my falafel or avocado so I had to ask them for it. I say it's pretty good, and healthy but the price is a little too steep for me. It's twice the price of eatsa, next time I'll eat there.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Entering it, one already wants to go in to sweetgreen for healthy living!

Getting my greens in with delectable dressings and sauce to go with. Other ingredients are options to add in.  

Drinks are refreshing and of natural sugar. 

15 bucks is about the norm when grabbing a sizable and green lunch around here.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I was a fan of Sweetgreen back when I lived in Boston and really missed it out here.  Luckily, for Yelp elite although I didn't attend the event was given a $15 promo code with the app to give it a try (thanks Yelp!)  In typical California style, I had just finished a sweaty afternoon session at FlyWheel and really needed a healthy AF salad to dig right into.  I quickly ordered a "create your own" through the Sweetgreen app and walked right over to pick up my order. 

This new location is much larger than the one I used to frequent in Boston.  On a sunny Saturday afternoon around 1230 the place only had a few customers so I was able to walk right up to the counter for my order.  They hadn't finished it yet, which was actually nice because I was able to tell them to use light dressing and that I wanted to eat it there rather than take it to go (there is no option to choose dressing on side or light dressing with the app).  The staff was so friendly and helpful making sure they got my order correct.  I was able to grab a window seat with my salad and dig right now while using their FREE WIFI to browse the internet. 

This 'make your own' salad I got was MASSIVE.  The thing was overflowing with fresh ingredients and even to the point where I couldn't finish it because it was so packed full.  Not sure why some people have said they thought it was a bit skimpy with the fillings because I got the hook up for sure.  I also paired it with the carrot-turmeric fresca drink that was so refreshing and tasty.  

One thing I love about sweetgreen is that it is all natural and you can really see what is going into your food.  When ordering through the app you can see the calorie count for your dish and the drinks have no sugar added (there is agave on the side if you want to sweeten it up a tad).  Sweetgreen is able to source from local farmers and highlight where their products are coming from on a menu board inside.  So, yeah, you are going to pay about $15 for a meal, but it's San Francisco, people are paying $20 for a burger and fires, $18 for a craft cocktail, so paying $15 for a healthy and sustainable dish isn't something people should be pouting about.  I love ya, Sweetgreen, I'll be back!
author: Kelsey B.

description: Love the food here. Always fresh and delicious. I tried the option of ordering online and picking up at the restaurant- worked like a charm!food was ready perfectly on time. I just wish for more seating during lunch time, but we made it work ok. Highly recommend.
author: rinna s.

description:
I'd had sweetgreen once before when it was delivered to my office for a lunch meeting but found it pretty forgettable. 

I decided to give it another go today and ordered the redundantly named Mexican Corn Elote Bowl with warm quinoa, organic arugula, roasted corn + peppers, tomatoes, shredded cabbage, local goat cheese, spicy sunflower seeds and lime cilantro jalapeño vinaigrette.

This bowl was quite enjoyable and certainly something I'd come back for.
author: Miriam W.

description: I found a large orange and black bug in my salad. I order from sweetgreen multiple times a week and I am truly horrified by this. I understand that the ingredients are meant to be fresh but I would expect they be washed and reviewed before being served to the customer. I have many coworkers that also frequently sweetgreen who are as horrified and shocked as I am. Needless to say I will not be returning and I will tell everyone that I know who is a sweetgreen customer.
author: Carmen D.

description:
I tried using their app today to order my salad since I would be heading to downtown area. The app is simple to use, you get to choose a list of salads ranging from warm bowls to cold. You get to customize the toppings or add more to adjust to your taste. Once you pick your salad, you can choose what time to pick it up at the store. 

Once I arrived at the store there's an area shelf where I can pick up the salad and take it to go. It was super quick for anyone who is in a rush. I got the OMG Omega and it so good! I really like the light dressing on it and the salmon was delicious. 

I felt really healthy after eating the salad and the ingredients were really fresh and organic. The price is kind over-price for the salad tho :/  

If you are into high-tech salad and hipster photos, this is the place to go! B-)
author: Judy M.

description:
Place: simple and clean. Pretty many table and a good place to eat alone. Chair is not comfortable but not bad. We won't stay here long. 

Taste - Great and Fresh. Lots of ingredents for bowl and salads and sources. There are some customed menu and you can make your own one. 

Price - little bit expensive I think.

Order - It is convient to ordet with add. It is not difficult and easy and fast to take out at pick up self.

And they don't accept cash**
author: Da Won L.

description:
SoMa could be confused for Salad Central, because there are so many great salad options around every corner. 

Sweetgreen's concept is similar to other salad places - build your own salad or pick from one of the options and follow it down the assembly line to pay at the end. They have delicious warm bowls (I'd recommend the Pesto Portobello), with new featured salads every season. The interior is bright and airy and there's plenty of seating inside. It gets packed rather quickly and the line can be long, so I'm guessing they will continue to expand like other salad joints in the area. 

They have beautiful menus telling their story about supporting sustainable farming and local communities. Looking forward to supporting a great mission and eating yummy salads while I'm at it.
author: Shira W.

description:
As much as I love the food, the service here is funny. A couple of times they got my order wrong and one time they asked me if I could read what's on the menu for them. 

Other than that, the food is amazing, get the Shrumami (a favorite of mine). Get points often, get the app and order online so it's faster. The location is nice, chill vibe and photogenic. 

It is on the expensive side... but nonetheless will come back often.


So TLDR; good food, beautiful space, service could be improved.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I find the bowls at Sweetgreen refreshing and delicious, but I do think they are a bit pricey. 

I ordered the Shroomami bowl, which came with wild rice, kale, beets, sprouts, basil, sunflower seeds, tofu, portobello mushrooms, and a ginger sauce. By god it was delicious. Even though it seemed more like a salad, the bowl was still rich and filling nonetheless and the combination of flavors was perfect. 

However, it was also on the pricier side for salad ($12ish), which means it's something I can't justify eating all the time. Nonetheless it makes for a great little splurge once in a while! The inside of the cafe is also very brightly lit, modern, and clean. They have free wifi which is nice!
author: Allison T.

description:
Was in dire need of some greens and this delicious place was close by. Had the chicken pesto parm which comes w a slice of bread and a bunch of quinoa mixed in.
The dressing is real nice and the broccoli is a touch spicy in a good way. This is a delicious and tasty choice. The menu is very short and focused, I prefer that.
Good spot to crunch some tasty greens or make your own selection of ingredients.
author: Ed V.

description: I may be biased because I came here for dinner and thus avoided all of the lines, but sweetgreen is SO GOOD. I like the spicy sbazi salad, which is typically my go to, but everything is good including the harvest bowl and the rad thai. Better yet, everything is healthy and between 400-800 calorie, depending on whether you order a salad or a bowl. Great place and hope more locations open up throughout the city soon!
author: Sally C.

description:
Had the harvest chicken salad...

Pros:
Big salad
Good cheese
Good (free) accompanying bread
Healthy

Cons:
Dressing and the chicken were both really not great 
Though the staff were nice, they weren't exactly fast to get to me (and I was the only one there)
Why are salads now always $10+ ??!
author: Sydney W.

description: I didn't like the menu much! But either the option to create your one with the fresh local farm goods. Amazing like the galaxy! A bit overpriced but it costs to eat well. The server size thumb up. The service young hip staff nice spot!
author: Tippy T.

description:
My first thought upon entering: "OMG this place is so healthy... and hipster" lol. I came here with a promo code from Yelp; so I figured, why not give it a shot. I was so glad I did. 

sweetgreen is really easy to get to by walking or public transit since it's close to Market St. I was a bit confused when I first got there since there's a sign at the front that said they don't take cash, and to use their app. Eh, wtf? Anyway, after getting over my mild initial surprise, downloading the app made it easy to order and pick up the food - there's a corner where you can pick up your meals to go, which is great if you're in a rush and just want to run in and out. 

The meals they serve are (or at least seem) super-healthy - admittedly, healthier than what I usually eat, lol. I had the Pesto Portobello and my bf had the Warm Squash + Apple. Both meals were tasty, although he was still a bit hungry afterwards and was tired of eating kale. Maybe he should've gone with the Pesto Portobello too ;) The juice bar idea is great, but IMO didn't taste the greatest - maybe it's just the kind I had though.

sweetgreen may be a tad more expensive than what you may expect, considering what you get, but can't argue with the convenience and healthiness of it.
author: Bianca C.

description:
I pick up lunch from Sweetgreen at least once a week.

It's easy to see why it's a polarizing restaurant. The salads are pricey, the lines are long, and (while clean and pretty inside) the classic "locally-sourced from X" decor makes me half-question why I'm paying $15 for bourgeois lettuce.

That said, this is a restaurant that is a great go-to/staple for lunch in SoMa. Most bowls are healthy, and the place is run efficiently by a friendly staff.

Most days I go for a custom bowl, but would also recommend the Shroomami and the Pesto Portobello for a fresh and filling meal.

Tip: download the app and order before going in. Not only will you get more time to customize your bowl or salad without feeling the pressure to rush with a line behind you, but you'll also quickly get in and get out.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
I'm into it! Not that SOMA needed another overpriced salad joint, but since I'm a sucker and cough up the dough for said salads on a regular basis, why not have a fresh option in the rotation?

Sweetgreen's process is familiar: you pick a salad from their menu, and walk down the assembly line while they build it "with" you. Or you create your own. But really, their menu has tons of gourmet combo options, so I don't feel the need to customize. I got the Curry Cauliflower, and it was perfection: chicken, cauliflower, kale, raisins, cilantro dressing. They are pricey at about $12 a pop... but what isn't these days? Unlike Mixt Greens, these salads are lighter on the greens, heavier on the fillings, which I love. 

I'll definitely be back for more quick, healthy lunch stuff soon!
author: Nique F.

description:
Overall, the place has a cool, hipster environment, located close to Bart and downtown. Staff are friendly, ingredients are freshly made and food tastes good. Only slight negative is that I think it's overpriced for what you're getting. $13 for a kale Caesar salad with tofu?... 

Will I go back? If I'm in a group that wants to go but not sure I'd voluntarily go again on my own. The dressing wasn't spectacular and I feel you can find better salads for better prices.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Healthy, typically not the best tasting food, but you gotta do what's good for you.  My sister in law got a promo code for $15 credit to use when you download the Sweetgreen app so she gave it to me.  The walk from my office was a bit of a trek, but at least I could order ahead with the app.  And good thing, because the line was super long when I went to pick up my order.

I ordered the Warm Pesto Portobello bowl.  I kept the order as is.  It came with warm quinoa, roasted chicken, portobello mushroom, raw corn, hot chickpeas, spicy broccoli, pesto vinagrette and a slice of bread.  After tax it was just under $14.  Pricey indeed.  What I like about them though, they source locally and prep everything in house.  But, their site doesn't mention if they're organic?  I can't help but compare them to Mixt Greens which has a very similar concept, came first and also offers grain bowls as well.  I took my salad back to my office to indulge.  

It was a generous portion, but I remember being more full and satisfied with salads and grain bowls from Mixt Greens.  I was surprised that there was a decent amount of chicken.  I enjoyed the portobellos as well.  I think the chickpeas were not necessary and were oddly thrown in there.  The pesto vinaigrette was really light and they should have provided more for the large amount of food and just due to the ingredients, as it didn't coat much of the bowl.  But it was also a bit difficult to thoroughly mix it through everything in the bowl.  It would've been nice if it was a thicker pesto sauce vs. a vinaigrette too.  Their menu items sound good, so I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong dish, but for that much money, I'd rather go to Mixt Greens.  Plus the trek isn't as far either.  I don't think I'd return here, even to use the rest of the credit.
author: Cat C.

description:
Another trendy and expensive salad place...and I loved it! My salad was big enough for 2 lunches so TECHNICALLY it's almost free right?? I like that they have lots of non-animal options (vegan falafels that are actually tasty, avo, quinoa...). I did a DIY salad which was fun, and the little piece of bread they add is actually good bread. 
Long lines but not bad of a wait, and location is nice for commuters of all SF areas to get to. I'll def be coming back (just not every day so I don't break the bank on lettuce)!
author: Lindsey P.

description:
Lets say sweet green is good but not something I would crave for. Not something I would go out of the way to get. The portion is smaller compared to other FIDI places when the standard salads are from $12-$16. Shrimp add on is $4.5. I got the warm mushroom bowl. It was yummy and I was able to finish all of it. I think without the bread I would have left unsatisfied. 

I know its new but services is slow when there are so many staff working. Love the interior and the overall look of the place. You can order online for pick up because the line does get super long after 12:15pm. What I love is that they ask you for light, medium or heavy dressing.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Do not pay attention to the bad reviews, apparently vegans are irritable and too prestigious to wait in a line.

The food is great, fresh, delicious, great idea for a healthy option. I first visited one in NY and was super stoked to hear they have 3 bay area locations. I had the pesto portobello it was fantastic!!! Must try
author: Corey C.

description:
I took my order to go, so I can't say much about the actual Resturant. There were lots of people in line, and it was abbey modern, open, and well lit place to have a meal. 

On the fridge with Togo salads, there was little to no information about which one was yours. Just a bunch of names on receipts that were stuck onto the 30 or so bowls. I ended up finding my bowl in like 1 minute or two, but the process could've been better. 

The salad itself was mediocre. I ordered 3x chicken because I was very hungry. There was definitely more than 1 serving of chicken, but no more than 2. Much less than 3x... the sweet potato add on was a yummy addition though. 

If I got a chance to look at the food in person before ordering, I may have made better selections and would've like my choices better. 

My advice to you is to know what add ons taste like before deciding to put all of them on your salad
author: Alex S.

description: I eat here a ton and really like Sweetgreens but seriously this location needs to get quality control in hand. The amount of ingredients and accuracy of ingredients varies incredibly by the person making your salad. I know there's a mad rush after 11:00 but it's getting to the point I don't want to eat here anymore. I shouldn't have to tell the person to go back and correct or add reasonable ingredients because they rushed and added half of what they are supposed to. I say this and I eat here enough (gold member or whatever) that I actually know which employees to avoid. I'm not interested in playing roulette with my $15 salad.
author: David L.

description:
The salads are generally tasty (the Guacamole Greens salad is my favorite), and they keep the menu varied with seasonal options and locally grown produce.  

But they lose two stars because: 1) their prices are insane, even by San Francisco standards (nearly $14.00 for a basic salad!), and 2) their customer-loyalty program is as weak as it gets.  For these reasons, I visit Sweetgreen about once every two weeks rather than twice a week.
author: Matthew B.

description:
I was really impressed by how delicious and fresh the food tasted. I believe all the veggies are sourced locally and you can taste the difference. I ordered the Spicy Sabzi and really enjoyed it. The tofu is a nice add. You can customize your salad as well and the food comes out to $10-$15 depending on what you get. 

The space is beautiful! I wouldn't be surprised if it gets packed eventually during lunch time. Definitely gonna be a hit in the SoMa area.
author: Cindy W.

description:
My roommate raved about their portobello pesto salad, and she recreated it at home, which was AH-mazing. Seriously, I would've given her Sweetgreen recreation 5 stars. Needless to say, I was excited to check it out at their actual restaurant as well. When I walked in though, I felt like their bar was just kind of lacking. 

It wasn't expansive and fresh looking as other salad bar's I've been. The chicken looked kind of pale, the corn looked pale, the colors just didn't seem fresh and popping to make me say like "YES! They have wholesome, fresh and healthy ingredients". 

I got the pesto portobello salad, and it was quite good. I think the combination of the toppings were really good for texture and taste. Not usually a fan of arugula, but this salad really did it for me. Proportions were really skimpy, though. I'd say the extras (besides the leaves) would have made sense for half the amount of arugula leaves. I probably took out half the arugula, ate the other half with the mix of toppings to prevent myself from eating mouthfuls of plain arugula. Medium dressing wasn't enough, hardly tasted the pesto.
author: Ke C.

description:
The build-your-own salad option is my go-to on the sweetgreen menu. Super easy, affordable, and the ingredients are fresh! The pesto vinaigrette dressing is my favorite to pair with my greens (and complimentary slice of bread) so far. 

It's conveniently located in SoMa and a great lunch or dinner spot if you want something quick and on-the-go, or if you want to sit down and relax. The interior is really nicely decorated and has a cute, rustic feel. 

I've also visited the Berkeley location, and would recommend both!
author: Josephine L.

description:
Tried sweetgreen for the first time today! Let's quit gawking over the price because it's damn near impossible to get ANYTHING to eat for under $12 around these parts anyway, let alone something healthy. That being said, the portions are definitely smaller than other comparable salad slangers in the area. 

I had the Hummus Tahina salad. The separate elements of the bowl were tasty; I probably just wouldn't order this combination of things again (falafel, onion, kale, lettuce, tomatoes, not enough feta cheese). 

If I come back I think I'm gonna go with my first instinct and try the Guacamole Greens!

I appreciate that you can order online!
author: Aivy C.

description:
Summing up a lot of other reviewers thoughts:

- less $$ than mixed greens, but definitely smaller portions 
- more $$ than eatsa, but I gotta say it tastes way better

I walk all the way from 2nd/Bryant to go to this place and the one thing I love is that my food is always ready on time when I order ahead and CORRECT (I'm looking at you Sajj). It's a bit more money, but it's money I'm willing to spend for good, healthy food when I'm in a pinch. Yea, it would be a a stretch to do it everyday --- so don't.
author: Christine M.

description:
Food was great, but it was so loud it was impossible to enjoy eating in. Also, the service was so hustle bustle that I felt they were annoyed with me for asking a question, and then when I did ask a question, I couldn't hear their answers and they were more annoyed. They are in such a rush to get you through the line (a plus to strive for speedy service) that they made me feel frustrated and stupid (a big negative). 
If they smarten up their customer service, this place will get a higher rating from me.
Order To Go.
author: Martha P.

description:
Loved my custom bowl. I ordered online and it was waiting for me when I arrived.
The ingredients were fresh and tasty.
Not much more I could ask for when I want something convenient, quick and healthy!
author: Lauren H.

description: Nom nom nom. I love these salads! They have some really interesting combination - the Caesar and pesto salads are a couple of my favorites. A bit pricey, but I like to splurge here every so often for lunch.
author: Jackie L.

description: This place is a chain around the US but their salads are delicious! They source from local farms which is awesome. If you don't know what to get the kale Cesar is my fav (ask for extra dressing).
author: Celia L.

description:
I received a promo code from Yelp to Sweetgreens so I decided to try this place out when I was in the area. I've tried this place several times since then, but don't think I would actively come back here due to their high high prices. 

The decor of this place is very minimal and clean, and you can literally smell the freshness of the food as you enter in the place. I am very glad that I took the suggestions of other Yelpers and downloaded the app before coming here. Sweetgreens provides a lot of options to add to your salad, along with salads that are ready to order. By using the app, it allowed me to go through each item and take MY time to look at exactly what I wanted without the feeling of being rushed in line (it was soooo packed when I was there!). 

Immediately looking at the items and the prices for these salads, I can assure you that these are super-fresh-high-priced salads beyond compare. The salads I've purchased from Sweetgreens (pre-selected or customized) have all come out to around $13-$15. Pretty pricey for some greens. However, I guess they can justify their pricing since they use locally sourced organic ingredients for the salads. I also didn't get the friendly vibe from the workers when I was here, although the times I did come were during lunch/after work hours and they were pretty busy with a long line of customers.

Really fresh tasting salads, but a bit too pricey to have on a daily if you ask me.
author: Victoria K.

description:
TL;DR - great healthy eats in the soma area!

Pros - super tasty and (somewhat) healthy options, convenient location, quality ingredients, easy ways to order

Cons - pricey, odd service at times (the staff could be better trained)

Sweetgreen is definitely great if you know what's healthy. Some things taste amazing and just can't be physically possible of being healthy. If you are good about food knowledge then this place is great because there are so many choices for customizing a tasty and healthy salad/bowl. However, if healthy eating isn't for you, they still do have some super delicious options that are not completely healthy.

But yeah, they have a little something for everyone. Give it a try!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I've walked past this place so many times and I finally decided to stop in and try it out.

Robert gave me wonderful experience for my first time at sweetgreen. Thanks so much for the good time while I was waiting for my salad!

I ordered the Hummus Tahina and he fashioned me the most beautiful looking and tasting salad I've had in a while. Instead of dressing, I got a squeeze of lemon and it really makes the flavors pop!

The greens are fresh and the falafel and hummus were on point  You get a good value for what they've got. Everything is "expensive" in San Francisco. If you want cheap food, get a premade and average salad at Walgreens, or go to Burger King. But if you want good tasting food and quality ingredients, go to sweetgreen.
author: Angela S.

description:
I discovered Sweetgreen two summers ago when I was living in DC. I love everything about it: the food selection, the ambience, the local roots, and the service. I'm happy to say all of these qualities are consistent across the locations I've visited, including the SF location. 

The options and combinations are endless, and they're also very vegan friendly! I've never been disappointed with a Sweetgreen salad because the ingredients are always fresh, vibrant and scrumptious. The atmosphere of this particular location is modern, minimalistic, and warm. To give you a specific visual: it's totally Instagrammable (that's an adjective, right?). 

I'd eat here every day if I could but the only downfall (that usually comes with hip places like this) is the price. It's a bit on the pricy side, but definitely worth the cost.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Got a salad here, their "Rad Thai," and on pickup. At $14+ in SF to get shrimp with poo still in it...well, that's super gross. 

But I still go back. And now I get vegan salads. The spicy cashew dressing is pretty bomb...enough to get me back after poopy shrimp.

- S
author: SA S.

description:
It's a pricey salad.  But the location is convenient. 

The Hummus Tahina is tasty and healthy. The 0 calorie tea options, and 60 calorie Fresca drink options are all nice. 

All the produce used seemed fresh and tasted good. 

If you're looking for a quick healthy bite in this part of town, it be hard to do better. 

The price is a bit high for what you get, but not excessively so.
author: Eric P.

description:
I don't actually eat salads but I love Sweetgreen.  I modify the Harvest Bowl by removing the kale, adding broccoli and corn, and substituting cashew dressing instead of vinaigrette.  I can generally get two meals of out it so, for me, it's worth the wait and the price.

The staff at this location and the one I used to go to in NYC have always been so nice and accommodating.  I will go out of my way for this place.  Huge fan!
author: Rob G.

description:
Eh, not impressed. The Bay Bowl I got was ok. I didn't realize at the time that it's 705 calories. I feel like I could've gotten something more tasty somewhere else for that many calories. It wasn't worth it from a health or a price perspective.

The premade concoctions sounded average to me. I'm definitely not a salad person but the first time I went to Tender Greens, I was blown away. Sweetgreen does nothing for me.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Oh, sweetgreen. Where do I begin? 

I may be single-handedly supporting your franchise, much to my bank account's chagrin. The love affair began in NYC where I attended college and craved greens. 

Believe it or not, I've heard of people renting apartments in Manhattan based on their proximities to sweetgreen. 

You can imagine my excitement when sweetgreen opened up in SF, a five minute walk from my office. Hello, Harvest Bowl. Hello, Hummus Tahina. I've missed you dearly. 

These salads do not taste like salads. Non-salad people swear by them. 

Download the app. You get rewards like $9 off once you hit a certain level. You can also pre-order salads, but they only come un-tossed. 

This location caters to people eating inside the restaurant, with a salad-inspired mural painted by a local artist, David Bowie quotes on the wall, and a mini wooden staircase where you can sit with friends. 

Sweetgreen did the unthinkable. It made salad cool. Their gift cards and T-shirts read "Beets Don't Kale My Vibe" and "Becky with the Good Pear." Need I say more?
author: Aletta H.

description: First timer! I got the Guacamole Greens salad. I am a HUGE fan! Huge serving, delightful fresh and crisp greens, and tasty dressing. I felt like the dressing was massaged into the greens. Yum! Definitely made with LOVE. The only problem I have is there pricing. I understand, they are getting their money, but dayum...can poor people eat good too? Why are our options always fast food GMO restaurants like McDonald's or Burger King or having to make our own food and pack it? If you got a family of six...can we really be eating at sweet greens? I hope the owner is reading this. Maybe they can offer a $5 dollar menu once a week? I don't know. Just putting my two cents in. But yes, would definitely recommend.
author: E C.

description:
The SoMa salad game is strong. Within a couple of blocks in this densely populated lunch zone, there exist numerous options for your fast-casual salad grazin'. There's the original, Mixt Greens, and then Tender Greens, Split Bread, and now Sweetgreen. All of them similar in nature - walk up, stand in line, order a salad off the menu or make up a custom one, and watch them make it in front of you, sort of like a Subway assembly line.

Compared to the other options in the area, Sweetgreen comes in at a solid 3.5. The concept is concept-y. You could walk in here and be in any other salad assembly joint. The space is bright and open. The salad selection is short and to the point. And the options are healthy. But when it comes to execution, the salads sit somewhere below Mixt on my hierarchy of SoMa salads. The top being Tender, the second being Café Madeleine, the third being Mixt... 

So yeah. It's convenient and healthy enough to round up to a 4. I won't stay away, but I won't rush back. It's good and I'm glad it's an option. Anywhere else with a lower density of lunchtime salad options would have this as a 4-star easy. 

Is this review equivocal enough for you?
author: Don B.

description:
Solid salad place. My vegan pre-made option tasted fresh and was very filling thanks to tofu in it. I love the carrot vinegar! Price for the vegan spicy salad was around $11 including tax. All the ingredients are from local providers.  I was impressed by the farmers list on the wall.  

Friendly, fast and fresh!
author: Liza B.

description:
Sweetgreen-what a great concept. Farm fresh veggies. It's challenging to eat out with friends and eat healthy. Sweetgreen solves that. The prices are comparable to a standard restaurant dish. 

I enjoyed the Guacamole Greens. I was surprised to see chicken in it since I assumed this would be a vegetarian place. You can select the amount of salad dressing you wish. It comes with a slice of bread.
author: Julie S.

description: I don't know whether to call this a salad place or a bowl place because I feel like it's both. Regardless, it's delicious. I'm always on the lookout for "quick" vegan bites to grab on breaks or lunch, and this place is one of them. Though there is usually a line around lunch time, you can place your order online and pick it up which is a really convenient feature! I order The Shroomami bowl and it's always fresh and hits the spot. They have a massive list of their ingredients and the places they're sourced from, so I give `em 5 stars for transparency.
author: Lauren W.

description: I'm a sweetgreen loyalist, but this location definitely skimps on portions. I typically come on weekdays at non peak lunch times (1pm) so it might be worth to avoid the lunch rush in general. Here's a picture of my uneaten spring chicken salad with mesclun substituted with rice. Looks like only 1/2-2/3 of what I was supposed to get.
author: Jonathan X.

description:
Walking into sweetgreen reminded me of downloading any of the stylish new apps that are out there: slick, simple and designed through and through. Unfortunately, for me that wasn't a good association: I'd seen it all and it just looks a bit too cookie-cutterish: been there, done that...

The ordering experience was also strange: there was a long line in front of the counter and the assembly line behind the counter was weirdly similar: "Hi, I'm so-and-so, and I'll be preparing your bowl today", my "sales associate" says and then pushes my bowl past the various food stations and fills it with food items.
