It all felt a bit wrong, as if I was in a car factory seeing my car being assembled. I know that this concept is not unique to sweetgreens, but it seriously felt strange here...

What also quite annoyed me was the noise level: my lunch partner and I couldn't understand a single word, unless we were shouting at each other. And him being a polite Brit, that wasn't an option...so we took our lunch to go and sat down at a park nearby. As for the food, that was fine - I had the curried cauliflower bowl - but honestly, for $13+ dollars I expected a bit more food. It was a meager portion :-(
author: Uli B.

description: Long lines but fast service. Trick is to be there at 11:50 during lunch time. They also have a user friendly website through which you can place an order to pick up. Lots of vegetarian options.
author: Sushma R.

description: Had the worst experience today with one of the people who were working there. He had a terrible attitude from the start and started throwing the ingredients in the bowl. When he was the one who accidentally put hot sauce in my salad he glared at me and angrily threw my salad in the trash when I asked him to make another one. He then angrily made me another salad but was glaring at me the entire time. I go to sweetgreen on the daily and was VERY disappointed that this happened today - this has never happened to me with anybody else working there. This does not make me want to go to sweetgreen anymore
author: Hannah K.

description:
This was literally my favourite salad place when I lived in DC and I was so pumped that they've opened in the FiDi! 

What I love about Sweetgreen is that they do a really awesome job of sourcing local ingredients and using local farmers- when you go in there's a big chalkboard with a list of all of the farmers and the ingredients, which is awesome. 

I also love that they have great salads that you can pick from or you can build your own- I opted for the Rad Thai salad, a slightly spicy salad with shrimp, sunflower seeds, cabbage bean sprouts and more. If you opt to make your own, you can choose 4 of the 24 standard toppings. They've also got a number of premium toppings if you want to add on-

The salads range from $12-$16 which is a bit pricey; however their commit to local produce and the quality of their ingredients makes this totally justifiable in my opinion.

Pro tip as I'm sure they're super busy during lunch - you can order ahead and your salad will be waiting for you when you come in :)
author: Elliott W.

description: Forgot my card and only had Apple Pay available. The team was going quick to help and cover cost. This was my first sweet greens experience and certainly not my last. Thank you! PS please fix locations available payment options!
author: Colin H.

description:
sweetgreen is a cool hip restaurant offering green-oriented dishes. I don't usually just go for salads but the salad here was good and I could see myself coming back (definitely helped that they had chicken!). It's a little bit like Chipotle where you move down the offerings conveyor belt style, slowly adding to your ever-growing heaping bowl of salad. You'll walk away with a giant bowl of salad and that's a good thing- just because you're eating healthy doesn't mean you have to go hungry!

They have pre-made options for you to choose from on the menu and I went for the portabello chicken. The portabello mushroom was pretty good but I wished they had added more chicken to it. Beyond that, my only complaint is that the acoustics of sweetgreen made it hard to hear. I'm not completely sure what it was, but both my friend and I agreed that not only was it hard to hear the food worker who was taking our order but it was also hard to hear each other even though we were sitting at the same table. I think the acoustics of the room made it so that all the conversation echoed more than it normally should.
author: Philip W.

description: Sweetgreen never fails. I have Eaten several locations to include Chicago, NYC and twice (2 separate locations here in Cali), consistency across the board.i opted out of my usual the harvest bowl for something with a nice kick, the advocado green bowl.. either are delicious. I can assure, once you try you will become a lifer
author: Michelle V.

description:
Came here with a friend for lunch and we loved it. I got the Shroomami and omg, it was amazing. Although it had no meat, it tasted like it honestly had meat in it, lol. So that was nice. 

I highly recommend you try this place. This place is super casual and good for casual lunches, with friends or co-workers. 

The prices are about $12 per salad, so there's that. Not too fond of the prices but then again, it's DTSF so they tend to jack-up the prices.
author: Rose E.

description: It's Saturday afternoon in the SOMA District of San Francisco. Street parking was not a problem. I first tried Sweetgreen in Los Angeles last month. My wife is vegetarian so she ordered the Shroomami Bowl and I ordered the Miso Bowl. The bowls are filled with farm fresh greens. It is so clean and fresh at SG, no kitchen odors. The staff is friendly, mixing all of your ingredients so ever bite has dressing. Every order comes with a slice of fresh bread (No butter). Be ready to chew yourself healthy at SG.
author: Kailey W.

description:
It was nightmare. I find a bug in my salad. 
So crowed and bug in your bowl for $12 peach salad.
author: BO W.

description:
Sweetgreen is just not what it used to be. I was one of the lucky people to experience sweetgreen during the early glory days in Philadelphia when the chain was emerging. Back then everything was better - the flavors, the quality of ingredients, the actual cafes, and the menu. I once ate sweetgreen for every meal it was that good! Now it's mediocre at best. The menu is more limited. The locations are messier and not run as well. Worst of all the flavors aren't as good or fresh. I've tried the steelhead a couple times and it's just SO FISHY gross. The cucumbers are shaved too thin and wilt and lose their satisfying crispness. The tomatoes were mushy and the red onions were sparse. They also have no problem charging extra for avocado and serving you
Something either over or under ripe- I've gotten both. I used to dream about sweetgreen coming to the Bay Area, but every time I've gone I've been disappointed. Will stick to mixt from now on.
author: Sam L.

description: I love the salads but they are pricey.  They only accept credit card. You can order beforehand on the app which is great during lunch rush.   Last time i was there at night and the place was filthy.  They really need someone going around regularly cleaning the mess up.  I'll continue to go here until i find somewhere better.
author: Craig F.

description:
My friends in NYC have been raving about sweetgreen for ages, so I was super excited when I heard that this location opened up in FiDi. 

So far I've been here 3 times and have tried the Chicken + Brussels, Curry Cauliflower, and Kale Caesar. I have to admit, I was pretty impressed each time. Delicious dressings (in particular the Spicy Cashew), good toppings, fresh produce - all in all really solid salads. I also like the convenience of being able to order via their app. Not only does it allow me to take my sweet time to customize my order (I'm a very indecisive and picky eater), but I also get to bypass the long lunch line. The only downside is that they only toss in dressings for orders in person! Regardless, 5 stars for taste, convenience and customization. 

On the other hand, I'm not so impressed by the portions and prices. While I know the average price for a salad in FiDi is $10-$15, other lunch spots serve much more generous portions. I really can't justify going to sweetgreen often because I feel a bit cheated. Case in point, I can get something similar to their Curry Cauliflower quinoa bowl at Eatsa for double the portion and half the price. Hence, 3 stars for portions and prices. 

Despite the higher prices and smaller portions, I'll probably still end up splurging here once a week. Their salads are too delicious for me to say no!
author: Cindy L.

description:
I like sweetgreen's offerings, but the lunchtime competition in the area is difficult. The menu descriptions don't seem to convey exactly what a dish will be - a warm cauliflower dish was really tasty but much heartier than any of us thought from the description, while some of the salads were lighted than expected. I liked the kale Caesar just fine but will try something different next time.

Maybe more exploration of the menu would be helpful, but it was hard for us not to notice that the prices were ~2x more than Eatsa. Furthermore, at least one coworker doesn't think she'll be able to walk past Tava to come back. And somehow the setting is a little harsh - it's very noisy and it seems like no matter where you sit, you will be in the way of foot traffice. Still, I'd like to try more of the offerings.
author: Lisa K.

description: Always love a sweetgreen and happy yo have one near my office. The lines can be really long but just order ahead via the app and skip the line every time. Super easy.
author: A B.

description:
Sweetgreen will not mix salads ordered online. They used to do it, but not any more.

If you like eating a pile of tomatoes, followed by a pile of carrots, followed by a pile of kale, this is your place. If you want a mixed salad like 99% of Americans, try another joint.
author: Jerzy G.

description:
Best. Salad. Ever. I will gladly spend $12 on a beautiful, nutritious, healthy, wholesome, fiki-fiki-fresh salad before I purchase an alcoholic beverage for $12. 

I recently started following the ketogenic diet, and sweetgreen makes it easy and exciting to follow the rules. They put hella greens. Keyword- hella. Lots of choices to customize your salad. I haven't even read the menu. I just look at the ingredients I want and go from there. Everything tastes so fresh and delicious as the food comes from farms nearby. Of course sweetgreen is gonna be "on the pricy side"-- we are paying for the convenience of a fresh, nutrient-dense meal at fast food speed. 

My go-to keto bowl- kale, spinach, avocado, cucumber, broccoli, feta cheese, egg, chicken, Parmesan crisps, lime juice, and olive oil. And two saltbae sprinkles of chili pepper flakes because ya girl is sensitive to spicy but still likes a little flavor. No bread!

Enjoy! Stay healthy.
author: Sheila D.

description: the salads are pretty good - a decent amount of calories (unlike mixt) for sf fidi pricing. i love the order ahead option - even though it's not mixed and you have to struggle with the small plastic fork to mix yourself. ive been here twice and have felt pretty full from a lunch salad!  good option around fidi if you're working late as well and dont want junk.
author: Christina L.

description:
I've heard some good things from my friends in NY so I was interested to finally try it! I went at noon and the line wasn't so bad, though there were maybe 15-20 customers in front of us it took about 10 min to get to the front of the counter to start the order. 

For my first time here I tried the Rad Thai Salad with light dressing. The portion was just enough that I was satisfied. For $14 (Agh so pricey!) I really expected a little bit more shrimp. The person making my salad gave me one scoop but I could buy a pound of shrimp at the grocery store for $10. 

That being said, I did enjoy my salad. The citrus shrimp was slightly sweet and refreshing. You can choose light, medium, or heavy amounts of dressing. I'm glad I got "light" because it was dressed just right with everything coated without dressing pooling at the bottom. I liked all the ingredients, and the greens seemed fresh and crisp. I think you can ask for the dressing on the side if you're very particular.

I understand they had just opened so I can understand why the person making my salad didn't know which ingredients the Rad Thai had. She was a little flustered (poor thing) and was asking her coworkers what went into it. I was willing to patiently wait, because it seemed stressful getting all the orders during the lunch rush. She was still helpful, as she assured me that they were getting more bean sprouts from the back (they had run out when it came time to build my salad).

They passed out samples while we waited in line. I tried a sample of the Caesar Salad. It was a somewhat unique dressing with a more refreshing lemony version of a typical caesar dressing, which I really enjoyed. 

My coworker ordered the Spicy Sabzi Salad, which was too spicy for her to finish her salad. 

I'm definitely looking forward to coming back to try a warm bowl or maybe build my own salad.
author: Candice C.

description: Don't want to bump it down to 3 until I try some other salads but the rad Thai salad was horribleeee! I think it was the dressing but wow. Had to toss it out after 2 bites. Yuck
author: Laura D.

description: Out of all of the overpriced healthy salad places in financial district, this one is my favorite. Mostly for the convenience factor. You can order ahead on either their website or the app and it will be there waiting for you at 12pm so you can skip the incredibly long line. I've learned that it's cheaper to order one of their prefixed salads and add/substitute ingredients you want than make your own salad. I ended up spending $17 on a salad that way... ridiculous. My favorite is the Kale Caesar. I always like adding the seasonal warm vegitable (spicy broccoli or brussel sprouts). I like the decor of the place too. Very open with a good amount of seating and lots of plants/succulents!
author: Alex S.

description: I like to build my own salad with romain lettuce (not a fan of arugula and kale which is what most of their salad combos have), grapes, cheddar cheese, onions, broccoli, cucumbers, and balsamic vinaigrette (they tend to go heavy with the dressing). The total comes out to be ~$13... which is normal for a salad in SF I guess. It's filling, and somehow extremely delicious... Why is it so good?! Is it the cheddar cheese chunks?! I don't get it!! I'm addicted!!
author: Annie S.

description:
Kale caesar salad is a game changer.  
Hierarchy of best salads in the SF is definitely:
1. Sweetgreen
2. Tendergreens
3. Mixt Greens
author: Brianne J.

description: Way overpriced for a salad but it's quick and convenient. Place gets filled up during lunch and dinner hours so that means long lines. I'd eat here daily though if the price wasn't so much, it's a healthy alternative to everything else around the area!
author: Shermond W.

description: I wish this place was good. The location is awesome and their online ordering/pickup is really easy, but the food just isn't good. I ordered the spicy sabzi salad and customized it a bit, which I thought would make it better suited to my tastes. It didn't taste very fresh, which is odd because I ordered it at 11:45 am and picked it up at 12 pm. Everything in the salad tasted slightly warm, like it had been sitting out all day. The only real flavor I tasted was bitterness, which came from the kale. Probably won't be eating here again. There are lots of better options in Soma. Also, I know people who ate here and had their credit cards charged twice for their meal.
author: Sara T.

description: I REALLY like this place. I like that they have several options to choose from or that you can make your own meal. Their lemonades are DELISH. However, I think the one downfall is that its kind of expensive. The bowls are pretty big, but I can't always justify spending that on lunch.
author: Makenzi B.

description: Just ate my salad and still hungry! I got the omg omega bowl which was $15 after tax. The flavor was good. But the salad was very loosely packed inside and it was barely an appetizer size. I'm used to overpaying for a salad but atleast I'm full after from places like mixt greens, tender greens, cafe Madeline, etc. now I have to go buy something else to eat.
author: Jean L.

description: I'm crazy for kale and sweetgreen has a few tasty kale salads.  Low calorie also a bonus!
author: Leah C.

description:
TLDR:
Service : Loud, rude, unhelpful (I usually do pick up, order on phone) - (1/5)
Decor : Trendy but noisy - 4/5
Food : 5/5
1. Hummus Tahina Salad -Lots of fresh vegetable, delicious hummus and falafel - 5/5
2. Pesto Portabello Salad - warm and flavorful - 5/5
3.  Matcha Fresca - Not too sweet and delicious - 5/5
4. Cucumber Ginger Lime fresca  - Less sweeter than Matcha Fresca and refreshing - 5/5

I have never had a disappointing salad from Sweetgreen. They are expensive but what is not in SF. It is my go to place for unplanned healthy dinner and lunches. The vegetables are fresh, highly customizable and delicious! Their recommended salad combinations are always my go to. I had the Hummus Tahina and Pesto Portabello. Hummus Tahina had one of the most delicious falafel. I always go for light dressing on it.  Pesto Portabello is perfect for a light dinner for 2. It is a warm bowl with lots of veggies. I usually never get drinks but Sweetgreen has perfect sweetness in their drinks, just enough for it not to be sour. The new Matcha Fresca is a winner. I hope it stays! The Cucumber Ginger Lime fresca is wonderful and refreshing.
The ordering can't get easier, you order it on their app and pick it from the side dedicated to pick ups. But remember sweetgreen claims to compost your food if you don't pick up in 30 mins to maintain quality. I am here for quick delicious healthy food and not service.
author: Kritika K.

description: Sweet green sources its vegetables from local farmers and for this I think they are remarkable. You can be sure that you're getting fresh vegetables every time. I've had the opportunity to have their guacamole greens which is a mix of different ingredients which is absolutely delicious. I love going to sweet green. Their staff is friendly and the shop looks amazing. I will be returning again soon for more awesome goodness.
author: Janette S.

description: I always go there. It is a great option for a quick and healthy lunch. Price is affordable, cheaper than other salad places around. Sometimes the line is crazy, but it is usually fast. It's for sure my best option for salad close to the office. I'm changing job and I will miss this place.
author: Rafael M.

description: I love this place! Yes the line could get pretty long but its for a reason ( salads are great, and fresh) you can also order online ahead of time.  All ingredients feel fresh and i feel the amount served is more than enough. It is one of my favorite salads bars. Will keep coming back!
author: Jessi L.

description:
I love the approach of sourcing ingredients to their best season. This definitely ensures that each bowl will be sweet. It's sort of like a chipotle style where there's premade salad and bowls, but also the option of diy. Why re-invent the wheel when it already works right? So I ordered the Shroomami. 

Shroomami as the name sounds is a bowl of mushroom yumminess. The bowl contains organic wild rice, shredded kale, raw beets, bean sprouts, basil, roasted sesame tofu, warm portobello mix, spicy sunflower seeds and topped with miso sesame ginger dressing. It was the best salad I've ever had. Everything worked well and the ingredients were definitely fresh. 

I finished every bite including the bread that came with it. Although I was satisfied, I wasn't sure how I really felt about it. I just paid $16 + tax for a bowl that left me wanting more. Sure it was tasty as heck, but I don't really know if I would go out of my way. It was something definitely easy to make at home. However, being in FiDi, everything is bound to be pricey. 

For healthy nuts out there, sweetgreen would be your to go place. It's always awesome to know where your food comes from. They have a chalkboard that lists out the locations of their source. Oh nice, from California :)
author: Fiona L.

description: LOUD/BAD ACOUSTICS! Good salad. Expensive/on point prices (for SF). Kind of a funny factory set up. I loved the drink options - not sweet, but tasty and low calorie.
author: Andrew K.

description: Came here for the yelp elite event and the food was pretty amazing. It's in downtown and parking is probably a b*tch to get here. I couldn't figure out what to order on the menu so I asked the worker and she told me that the guacamole greens were her favorite so I went with that. Good thing I listened to her b/c that salad really was good. It was super filling too. There's a lot of other stuff on the menu like a warm bowl that I like to try next time. Pricing is a bit pricey and I think it was about $13-16 from what I recall. The place has a lot of seatings and it's a really nice atmosphere to sit and eat. Will be back next time if I'm in the area!
author: Monica W.

description:
Sweetgreen in downtown SF -- I've been waiting for this day!  As a real loyalist (back to the early days in DC and as a frequent visitor to the various NYC locations about town) I left work as quickly as I could on opening day to grab lunch at this location.  What a disappointment!  

To start, the ingredients didn't look anywhere near as appealing as other locations -- the chicken looked overcooked and dry, the steelhead was so overcooked in the pan that every piece the sides had started to curl, the roasted sweet potatoes simply unappetizing looking, the corn was white, etc etc...

While I understand that when places first open, there are often kinks, but compromising on quality ingredients cooked well is a real no-no, especially on opening day!  It is freshness, attractiveness, and quality cutting, cooking, and maintaining of the ingredients which are core to the appeal of this business!  Plus, this is the Bay Area, home to many of where these ingredients are grown and only blocks from one of the premier farmers' markets on the planet.  Sourcing should not be a problem here. 

Frustratingly, this location also truly skimped on how much was put in my bowl.  In NYC & DC I don't mind paying $12-17 for a fresh, high quality saiad which I can eat across two meals, but I REALLY mind paying the same amount for the same salad to still be hungry after one meal.  

SF location: get better ingredients, don't over cook them and don't be chintzy!  

There's a reason this place is so popular; but don't expect people to sing your praises simply because they have sipped the cool-aid, make the cool-aid good!
author: Rebecca F.

description: Worst sweet green I've been to. I was super excited to finally get one here in the city but it was a HUGE disappointment!!! The portion of what I ordered was SO SMALL, only filled less than half the size of the bowl. Definitely not worth what I paid for. I almost said something to the counter about it but I had already called my LYFT. No desire to come back here unless their reviews start going up and they start giving the deserved portion sizes.
author: Anastacia W.

description:
I happily went to the SOMA Sweetgreen for a few weeks thinking I had found my new tasty, health place. Lines are always long and turnover is as fast as it can be -- which has apparently made the restaurant workers a bit arrogant and reckless. Their health inspection of 77 out of 100 was proven today (and perhaps a bit generous) when my boss pulled a long black hair (no, it wasn't mine) out of his teeth.  He said it was buried underneath his salad.  Just because a restaurant is doing well doesn't mean that workers can or should take shortcuts around not pulling their hair back (both men & women) or think that hair in salads couldn't begin to hurt their business. I ate there almost every day, and now I refuse until their health inspection rating isn't back up above at least 92 and I see employees showing more respect for the food and their customers. Refocus more on quality and sanitation and less on haste. My advice. Better yet, steer clear of Sweet Green until they take health & sanitation seriously. Disgusting. 

I will gladly walk all the way to a Japanese restuarant that begins with 'D' in the Ferry Building for a healthy meal if it means I don't have to worry about writing reviews like this.
author: C A.

description:
$17 - $18 for a salad and a lemonade with no sugar is just too expensive - even for SF. 

The service here is excellent though.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
It was ok. I got the Guacamole Greens, which according to one employee was the original salad they're known for. I felt like it was overly simple and the dressing could have been purchased at any Sprouts or Trader Joe's. Given $13 price tag, the portion did not match. While others such as Mixt Greens or Tender Greens charge near the same or more, they match with larger portions as well. So 2 *'s off for all of that. 

Finally, one * off because I told the employee who made my salad that I was allergic to eggs and so want to make sure my dressing did not have that or any kind of ranch type dressing. She assured me it did not, though the bad hives I broke out in a few hours later told me different. Not a huge deal since they go away at some point, but would have been nice if they double checked. I guess it's worth noting that the dressing may not have had any egg component and it was simply cross contamination from mixing bowls not properly being washed between use. :/ Even though I work next door and the people are really friendly, I'm not likely to go back given so many lunch options around there.
author: F. M.

description:
I have tried this place twice. Both times my salad cost $15 for 4-5 toppings. I can handle that, I get that I'm in the financial. What I can't handle is that they only fill the little plastic bowl half way. If I'm going to pay $15 I expect more than 1 tbsp per topping and definitely at least a full bowl of lettuce. The first time I accepted that they were new and didn't understand proportions. Second time, nope, now I'm just cheated. Maybe it's why so many tiny little girls come here, they get to maintain their diets without any extra effort. I'm getting hangry after my meager salad, on to the break room snack machine...

I must add that as soon as I posted this SweetGreens contacted me concerned about the underperformance of this location. Apparently they aren't trying to keep me skinny and angry. Kudos for the quick response. The salads are delicious so maybe I'll be back.
author: Helen W.

description: My husband and I go to Sweetgreens about once a week. We absolutely love their Harvest Bowl (goat cheese sounds weird, but it tastes delicious!) and the staff is always really friendly and personable. I wasn't a huge fan of the Rad Thai, because the shrimp tasted a little off, but everything else I've tried has been fantastic.
author: Sarah B.

description: It is so hard to find a place to eat that actually has healthy options. Not only does this place offer healthy options in spades, it tastes amazing too! The service is fast and friendly and if you're really in a hurry they have a gorgeous app that you can order ahead on. This is my new go to lunch spot!
author: Matthew M.

description:
The salads at sweetgreeen are great. They're on par with/a little better than those at Mixt.

Unfortunately, this sweetgreen isn't as well run as ohter sweetgreens I've been to. They're much slower at preparing the salads - the lunchtime lines are ridiculous and often take over 30 minutes to get through.

Also, I went in for a salad at 10:35am (they open at 10:30am) and they didn't have half of the ingredients ready for one of their most popular salads (guacamole greens). Disappointing that I had to wait an extra 10 minutes for some of the ingredients to be ready. Still, the server (Nene) did a great job of helping me out and apologized for the inconvenience--she was the only person who jumped in to help me after I stood there for a few minutes without being helped. If they ran this particular location better I've be five stars all the way!
author: Craig D.

description: I go to Sweetgreen on a regular basis in whatever city I can on work trips along the east coast. I was so excited when I saw that Sweetgreen came to SF and asked my boyfriend to go on his way home to get us some salads for dinner. When he got to my place I was in shock to hear about his experience and see the half filled salad bowls. He told me a dozen people were hanging out behind the counter but they weren't really paying attention to what they were doing. I was so bummed that this was his first experience. Usually I  go out of my way to grab Sweetgreen before I jump on flights because it's always so fresh and the staff is so personable. I hope this SF location gets it together otherwise I'll stick to my east coast locations and just grab salads elsewhere like Whole Foods, when I'm home.  Please get better! I love Sweetgreen!
author: Audrey R.

description: Small portion compared to Mixt Greens for about the same price. Quality of ingredients is definitely lower too. Everything tastes like it was made a day ago. Staff was quite friendly, but slow.
author: Ross R.

description: The Hummus Tahina Salad is to die for, and hands down the best salad I have ever had!
author: Erica Kat S.

description: Best salads I've ever had in my life. Order any combo of chicken/rice/shredded kale with the vinaigrette and you can't go wrong. Honestly its hard for me to eat salads anywhere else.
author: Riz T.

description: Great healthy options, friendly service. Plenty of seating and free wifi.
author: Vicki L.

description: Delicious salads with local ingredients.  However, 3 stars is for use of plastic containers :-(. This seems very incompatible with their business model.  Please switch to 100% compostable!!
author: Oren F.

description:
Food, drinks, and service were excellent - I love having a choice for healthy food in the middle of the city. As others have noted, the place is incredibly noisy at lunchtime. So you might want to consider getting your order to go. 

I really hope the restaurant can figure out some carpeting or wall hangings (or just something, anything) to reduce the noise in there. I don't see how the poor staff isn't deaf already. :(  

Also, I wish they would accept cash. The week I went they were trying out a "credit/debit" cards only (no cash) payment system - not sure if they decided to keep it that way or not.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Whelp. That's it. I'm done for.

Don't listen to these weenies - sweetgreen's customer service is top notch. A girlfriend of mine and I decided to be high maintenance after picking up our to go order, and grabbing a seat inside. We asked if they could toss in our dressing and what did a nice, sweet, kind lady do? Come to our table and mix it on up. 

Table side, delicious fucking service. Did I mention their curry bowl rocks?
author: Nicole M.

description: Awesome salads at a great price.  I particularly like the guacamole greens and the shroomami
author: Ben S.

description: The manager had responded to my comment and have issued a sincere apology to my previous experience. I'm happy to learn that they are taking initiative and making improvements to the store. I live around the corner and really want them to succeed!
author: Joyce C.

description: I'm so happy this opened up in SF! I was a loyal fan in NYC and had been missing these delicious, affordable salads ever since I moved. Highly recommend!
author: Ana M.

description: Love sweetgreen! Pro tip: download the app and put your order in beforehand. I highly recommend the guac salad or the mushroom warm grain bowl. Delicious! You can also customize your ingredients and pay in the app. You can then cut the whole line and not wait for your salad.
author: Clay P.

description: I love how you can make your own salad and how everything is fresh and tasty ! :-) I had a chicken salad and it was everything I could expect for a nice and healthy lunch.
author: Caroline P.

description: This is my Go-To - To-Go/Pick-up place for lunch on weekdays. (How about dat?! Say that 10X Lol) Let me tell a few things I love about that this place : 1) My lunches are already ready at the time that I select and I don't need to wait. It never fails. It's always ready! (I get lunch for me and my boss, sometimes for my team) 2) The salad selections are Ah-Mazing!  my favorites are: the Omega - spinach w/ Salmon & Avocado, Warm Squash Apple, Spicy Sabzi & the Carrot Tumeric Fresca! 3) you can tell that they only use fresh and organic ingredients 4) everything that I've had here taste super delicious 5)  it's 2 blocks away from my work 5) if you don't please pick it up in 30 mins, they'll throw it out and make you another one so it's fresh - especially if it's the Omega due to the salmon. I mean, throwing food is probably questionable but for them to make you a new one so it's fresh? How amazing is that?!! There's also someone by the pickup section looking out for people who need help finding their orders - which comes handy you can't find your lunch bag. The only downside that I can think of is probably the portion sizes. I mean, it's decent but compared to Proper Foods, SG is a little bit smaller. Overall though, I love this place! I come here 3X a week!! However, I will agree with some Yelpers that the portion could be a bit smaller than others. (i.e. Proper Foods, Mixt Greens etc.) BUT.. the taste and freshness of each bowl is INCREDIBLE! Also, if somehow you were not satisfied with your bowl (i.e. They forgot your dressing or skipped the chicken, just send an email to your online order and tell them what was wrong with your order. They will respond to you within the same day and give you a CREDIT $$. How amazing is that?!! I highly, highly recommend this for lunch (and dinner! I've picked up my dinners here a few times) If you're always busy like me and don't have time (and patience) to fall inline on workdays (mind you, the line is super long at lunch time) THEN, I recommend just order ahead of time, pick it up and eat outside especially if it's warm out. I go to Yerba Buena Gardens with my Omega bowl if it's sunny out!! Love Love Love Sweetgreen!
author: Anna Y.

description: I wasn't in the mood for a salad so decided to create my own warm bowl with brown rice and quinoa. I don't know who would pay $10.00 off the top for a small amount of quinoa and limited toppings (all the good toppings you'd actually want such as cheese, avocado, tofu, chicken... basically any protein is like an extra $6-10 together. Why they don't include a protein in the basic price I'm not sure. It's not like they are using costly ingredients what's so ever. Overall I had trouble choosing ingredients that went well together and at the end my bowl tasted odd. I asked the guy working for some guidance and he wasn't sure what went nicely together either! Haha. Anyways paying $18 for a small portion of food that doesn't offer anything more then basics you could cook yourself I wouldn't come back. There are so many other unique delicious healthy options in the area!
author: Hoku L.

description: This is quite possibly my favorite chain restaurant. Depending on how important healthy eating is to you, this place may not be as appealing. For example, you will not find sodas, instead you will find various iced teas. The food tastes sooo good and so fresh. You can create your own salad or pick from their list of options (which includes info about calories). There's lots of options for meats as well as vegetarian protein sources, cheeses, rice/quinoa, beans, nuts, fruits. I also love the seasonal options so I always have variety. The service was great and the dish is made in front of you. There's an option for bread on the side if you wish. This place is perfect for me because it balances taste and good nutrition. Again, if you're looking for fries and soda, not the right place. It's not cheap, most salads are between 10-13 dollars, but the food is so fresh and delicious.
author: Rachel L.

description: Ugh- they just got inspected and their health score plummeted to 77. I'll be avoiding this place until I hear more about what's going on and if they were able to clean it up.
author: saru k.

description:
Three of us tried this joint today. Overall, its tasty, fresh, fast and healthy.  Just a couple of issues...
My cauliflower salad was overpowered by garlic, from the first bite to garlic breath hours later. ( I do like garlic, including "40 cloves of garlic" chicken, so I'm not garlic averse). The flavors need to be better balanced. They also need to provide toothpicks for those of us whose teeth are prone to retaining green bits. 
My daughter had the rad Thai salad and enjoyed it. I thought it could be brightened up a bit with more lime. My spouse had the portobello mushroom bowl. He found it somewhat difficult to scrape the quinoa out of the bowl with the fork. But he liked the salad. 
Seating is ok, not great or particularly ample. Backs on chairs are uncomfortable if a person has thoracic spine issues. There is a seating area of backless tiered boxes for the young of spine. 
I'd eat here again but wouldn't choose the cauliflower salad again.
author: Patti H.

description: April 5 eve... amazing customer service - really nice people and the food? I come back. Yup. $15 salad? Likely. Occasionally skimpy on the good stuff but 3 of 4 time hooked it up. Thanks everyone!!! PS doggy scraps (inside joke)
author: John G.

description: I ordered through the app for 12pm pickup on Sunday. I asked if I could get my dressing mixed in with the salad and the lady told me no and walked away. The salad tastes bitter and each component of the salad is separated. This downgraded my Sweetgreen experience.
author: Ali L.

description: My favorite salad place in the history of life and should replace all the other salad places in SF. It's more reasonably priced than Mixt Greens and in general just much tastier and filling. It's also substantial enough for dinner but quick enough to be considered fast food (hereby replacing blue barn). Thank you for bringing this to CA!!!
author: Emily H.

description: They don't even answer the phone, no phone number, no cash, just buy and go. Like a factory is how they want it. Buy, go, don't speak, go give money, hire ALL illegals, throw in token other race, but hire 99.9% illegals, aren't they sweet?
author: Doc S.

description: Way too much hype around this place and the line that forms at lunch is batshit crazy (you can order online for pick up people!!). Not an amazing selection of toppings either. The only thing going for them is the price is slightly more reasonable than similar businesses nearby. Strong 'meh' on this one.
author: DeAnna C.

description: Oh perfect, just what my neighborhood needed... another insanely overpriced salad joint where even a scoop of cheese is gonna cost you. Unimpressed.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Fell in love with this place at first sight! Delicious and healthy fresh food, spacious interior, very friendly service, reasonably priced. Now I have a new favorite vegetarian cafe in San Francisco downtown!
author: Maxim A.

description: Been to the locations in NYC and I was super excited for the SF spot. However I was disappointed to discover that the portion sizes are significantly smaller in SF for the same items. In NYC one salad is two meals for me. They pack the greens in like crazy. Here in SF prices are more expensive and less product given. At least the taste is always satisfying.
author: Kel S.

description: Great salad offerings.  Had a very good lunch with colleagues.  Just needs a bit more seating.   Try to get there before noon.  It's a bit of a mob scene thereafter, for good reason.
author: Dylan S.

description: They do not accept cash.   You operate in the USA, and will not take US currency to pay for a meager portion of salad.
author: Jesse J.

description:
Sweetgreen is a great option for a healthy lunch in the city. They offer a variety of fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The topping options are made so well that I would eat them on their own! 

I ordered a combo bowl with a mix of both salad greens and wild rice. I loved that they gave me the option to have both, rather than choosing salad or a warm bowl. I highly recommend the spicy cashew dressing, which has an amazing, rich flavor. 

The only issues I have with this place are the prices (which can be a bit high) and the wait time. If you go during peak times you can expect a wait.
author: Hayley N.

description: My favorite salad place ever! Great selection of ingredients and everything tastes very fresh. I was a huge fan of this place when I lived in New York. I'm so happy it's finally in SF!
author: Katie R.

description: Hands down my favorite salad place in the soma area. So happy this east coast brand made its way to the Bay Area.  Super generous on the salad portions and a very friendly group of employees that always put a smile on my face.  Obsessed with the pesto dressing. Great protein options for vegetarians !!
author: Hayley G.

description: Had a great salad during lunch and loved that it was ready for pickup when I got there. Domo (I think short for Dominique ( was also very friendly and helpful when I wanted a cup for water and some napkins
author: Ream Q.

description: Worst customer service I've ever received in my life. Not worth the $15 salad. I will never come back, which is a shame because I love Sweetgreen. I frequented to the shop in Boston when I used to live there and the service was amazing and the place was so clean. Not the case here. I'm disgusted!
author: Courtney M.

description: Though it was on the pricey side for lunch (~ $12), it was worth it. I really enjoyed the Shroomami bowl and plan on going back to try some of the other bowls and salads. I definitely recommend ordering online. It's a great way to avoid that lunchtime rush.
author: Joshua R.

description: Totally unacceptable service at @sweetgreen 2nd street sf today. Meal more than 35 minutes late. Other than a feeble "sorry" no other attempt to address the awful service.
author: Neville M.

description: I really liked this place.  The salads are unique, the ingredients are fresh and locally grown, and the calories are listed.  The salads look just like the photos online.  They made my salad quickly and provided great service.  The drinks are also really unique, tasty, and they provide unlimited refills.  I will definitely be back.
author: Ghazal S.

description: I wanted to like this place. But they don't accept cash! Wha? So much for legal tender. Won't eat here again if they are not willing to take the money in my wallet.
author: Mark P.

description: Enjoyed it! Fast, friendly people, tasty food, and not a bad price. Seemed about the same price as Mixt Greens or a little cheaper. Had the Mexican style salad (can't remember the name), and it was quite great.
author: Maz A.

description: This place is so slow! The people who work here seem to be chosen for social reasons not proficiency. They chat, they chill, but they don't hustle. Waiting 15-20 minutes minimum at any time of day for a $15 salad is insane. Hurry up!!
author: Kate T.

description:
I love Sweetgreen! This was my first time in the new SF store. I love the bay bowl (add Brussels sprouts), and I also love the curry cauliflower. 

I want to give a SPECIAL shoutout to Kenny!!! I had misplaced my wallet (ugh) and was only carrying cash. Even though the store had a long line, he explained the situation clearly and patiently, which I really appreciated.

FYI- Apparently you can pay with the Sweetgreen app ... which I am downloading after I finish this review.
author: Angela H.

description: Lovely place with friendly staff and delicious salads! we had the chicken+Brussels and the pesto Portobello and they were both super tasty!
author: Mary B.

description: Great experience getting lunch at sweetgreen today. Their new location in SOMA is bright, clean, spacious and modern. Because I had heard good things about Sweetgreen's other locations and needed some fruits and veggies to counteract overindulging in carbs lately, I headed over to grab a quick lunch to take back to the office. I walked in and ordered the build your own bowl. The service was prompt and efficient. As I went to pull out my wallet, the nice woman helping and her coworker me told me it was free. In the land of $7 toast and lunches that cost at least $12, I was pleasantly surprised. Apparently their servers were down and since they don't accept cash, all meals were free. Not every establishment would stay open and continue to assemble lunches for no cost to the consumer. I appreciated how they handled the situation and loved my tasty salad! I got mixed kale, cucumbers, bean sprouts, roasted Brussels and shrimp with a ginger miso dressing. Delish!
author: Claire C.

description: This location is not good at all, I usually love sweetgreen I have been to several ones in NYC and in Boston but this is by far the worse one. Why it's so bad is because of the staff and how they work. When your creating your own salad many of the items are almost done and they give you the last sad looking pieces that's left and don't bother to go and get fresh new ones. I said I wanted tomatoes and I literally got three small cherry tomatoes. I also wanted quinoa in my salad and I could barley see that it was any of it in my bowl, my salad basically only existed of green leaves "salad". I really don't want to leave a bad review but this happened to me three times now and I tried to give this location a new chance hoping someone in the staff will do it better but non of them knows anything about customer service. For a salad that cost me 15 dollars I expect more. They should really do something about their staff. I'm not going back there again.
author: Dinah S.

description: The sweetgreen in San Francisco hasn't even open yet but I looks like there heading in the right direction. I walked in and I was greeted right away by the training staff member. They have me a feeling no other restaurant has given to me. They really connect with there guests. For a person new to the health eating they helped a lot. Keep doing exactly what there doing. Great job SOMA sweetgreen!!!!
author: Daniel M.

description: Loved sweetgreen in NYC when I first tried it, but this location is meh. Pretty chaotic during lunch hour although the long line does move fast.
author: Teresa K.

description: I'm sorry but the portion was small for the price.  Left still feeling hungry.  Mixt Greens is much better for the same amount of money and they have a better selection.  Won't be back to Sweetgreen.
author: Warren M.

description: Love this place. Staff is extremely friendly and efficient. Food is delicious. Can't ask for more, really.
author: Daniel M.

description: Great convenient place to get a salad.  I got there at 11:30 which means a line out the door at most salad places in that area, so was happy to get helped right away (guessing this won't last long).  People we very friendly and helpful.  I had a question about the ingredients in one of the dressings and they found the full nutritional info on the item right away.  Really appreciate the fresh locally sourced produce.
author: Alan R.

description: Came back at the end of opening week after being contacted by sweetgreen's community team. My salad was great and my friend loved his as well! A little bummed that the prices seemed higher than in NYC, but still super excited to have sweetgreen in SF.
author: Andrea M.

description: Came in for the free tasting. I got the Chicken and Brussels bowl and it was delicious! So happy they brought Sweetgreen to the West Coast
author: A G.
